```swift
import SwiftUI

/// A glass-morphism card with blur effect and border
/// Uses DesignTheme colors for consistent styling
struct GlassCard<Content: View>: View {
    let content: Content
    var cornerRadius: CGFloat = .radiusLarge
    var padding: CGFloat = .spacing4

    @Environment(\.designTheme) private var theme
    @Environment(\.colorScheme) private var colorScheme

    init(
        cornerRadius: CGFloat = .radiusLarge,
        padding: CGFloat = .spacing4,
        @ViewBuilder content: () -> Content
    ) {
        self.cornerRadius = cornerRadius
        self.padding = padding
        self.content = content()
    }

    var body: some View {
        content
            .padding(padding)
            .background(
                RoundedRectangle(cornerRadius: cornerRadius, style: .continuous)
                    .fill(theme.color(.card))
                    .overlay(
                        RoundedRectangle(cornerRadius: cornerRadius, style: .continuous)
                            .stroke(theme.color(.border).opacity(0.3), lineWidth: 1)
                    )
            )
    }
}

// ViewModifier version
struct GlassCardModifier: ViewModifier {
    var cornerRadius: CGFloat = .radiusLarge

    @Environment(\.designTheme) private var theme

    func body(content: Content) -> some View {
        content
            .background(
                RoundedRectangle(cornerRadius: cornerRadius, style: .continuous)
                    .fill(theme.color(.card))
                    .overlay(
                        RoundedRectangle(cornerRadius: cornerRadius, style: .continuous)
                            .stroke(theme.color(.border).opacity(0.3), lineWidth: 1)
                    )
            )
    }
}

extension View {
    func glassCard(cornerRadius: CGFloat = .radiusLarge) -> some View {
        modifier(GlassCardModifier(cornerRadius: cornerRadius))
    }
}
```

import SwiftUI

// MARK: - Enhanced DSButton with Icons & Loading
extension DSButton {
    /// Enhanced button with icon and loading state support
    init(
        _ title: String,
        icon: String? = nil,
        intent: Intent = .primary,
        size: Size = .m,
        isLoading: Bool = false,
        action: @escaping () -> Void
    ) {

        self.intent = intent
        self.size = size
        self.isLoading = isLoading
        self.icon = icon
        self.action = {
            // Add haptic feedback
            UIImpactFeedbackGenerator(style: .medium).impactOccurred()
            action()
        }
    }
}

// MARK: - App-Specific Button Wrapper
struct BrandButton: View {
    let title: String
    let icon: String?
    let style: ButtonStyle
    let isLoading: Bool
    let action: () -> Void

    enum ButtonStyle {
        case primary
        case secondary
        case destructive
        case outline

        var dsIntent: DSButton.Intent {
            switch self {
            case .primary: return .primary
            case .secondary: return .secondary
            case .destructive: return .destructive
            case .outline: return .secondary // Will customize
            }
        }
    }

    @Environment(\.isEnabled) private var isEnabled
    @Environment(\.designTheme) private var theme

    init(
        title: String,
        icon: String? = nil,
        style: ButtonStyle = .primary,
        isLoading: Bool = false,
        action: @escaping () -> Void
    ) {
        self.title = title
        self.icon = icon
        self.style = style
        self.isLoading = isLoading
        self.action = action
    }

    var body: some View {
        if style == .outline {
            // Custom outline style
            outlineButton
        } else {
            // Use DSButton for standard styles
            DSButton(
                title,
                icon: icon,
                intent: style.dsIntent,
                isLoading: isLoading,
                action: action
            )
        }
    }

    private var outlineButton: some View {
        Button(action: {
            UIImpactFeedbackGenerator(style: .medium).impactOccurred()
            action()
        }) {
            HStack(spacing: .spacing3) {
                if isLoading {
                    ProgressView()
                        .tint(theme.color(.primary))
                } else {

                        Image(systemName: icon)
                    }
                    Text(title)
                        .font(theme.font(.body))
                }
            }
            .frame(maxWidth: .infinity)
            .padding()
            .foregroundStyle(theme.color(.primary))
            .background(
                RoundedRectangle(cornerRadius: .radiusLarge, style: .continuous)
                    .stroke(theme.color(.primary), lineWidth: 2)
            )
        }
        .disabled(!isEnabled || isLoading)
        .opacity(isEnabled ? 1.0 : 0.5)

```swift
import SwiftUI

enum UserType: String, Codable {
    case athlete = "Athlete"
    case clubCoach = "Club Coach"
    case collegeCoach = "College Coach"
    case parent = "Parent"

    var accentColor: Color {
        switch self {
        case .athlete:
            return .blue
        case .clubCoach:
            return .orange
        case .collegeCoach:
            return .red
        case .parent:
            return .green
        }
    }

    var gradientColors: [Color] {
        switch self {
        case .athlete:
            return [.blue, .purple]
        case .clubCoach:
            return [.orange, Color(red: 1.0, green: 0.4, blue: 0.0)]
        case .collegeCoach:
            return [.red, Color(red: 1.0, green: 0.2, blue: 0.4)]
        case .parent:
            return [.green, .teal]
        }
    }

    var gradient: LinearGradient {
        LinearGradient(
            colors: gradientColors,
            startPoint: .topLeading,
            endPoint: .bottomTrailing
        )
    }
}

// Environment key
struct UserTypeKey: EnvironmentKey {
    static let defaultValue: UserType = .athlete
}

extension EnvironmentValues {
    var userType: UserType {
        get { self[UserTypeKey.self] }
        set { self[UserTypeKey.self] = newValue }
    }
}
```

### iOS Reduce Motion Behavior
When a user enables "Reduce Motion" in iOS Settings:
- SwiftUI automatically replaces spring animations with linear fades
- NavigationStack pushes become simple cross-fades
- Sheet presentations use minimal motion
- All custom `withAnimation` calls are automatically dampened
- Parallax effects are disabled

```swift
// âœ… Let SwiftUI handle it automatically
.sheet(isPresented: $showSheet) {
    DetailView()
}

}
```

```swift
// âŒ Avoid complex spring animations
withAnimation(.interpolatingSpring(stiffness: 100, damping: 10)) {

    withAnimation(.linear(duration: 10).repeatForever()) {

    }

            }
```
```swift
        }
}
```

- All automatically respect reduce motion âœ…

   - App launch (splash screen)
   - Navigation between tabs
   - Opening modal sheets
   - Navigating through search results
   - Profile navigation
3. Verify no jarring animations occur

### Expected Behavior:
- âœ… Smooth, minimal transitions
- âœ… No spring/bounce effects
- âœ… Simple cross-fades instead of complex animations
- âœ… App remains fully functional

## Conclusion

The AthleadAI iOS app demonstrates excellent reduce motion compliance by:
1. Minimizing custom animations
2. Relying on SwiftUI's automatic reduce motion support
3. Using brief, simple animations where custom ones exist
4. Not conveying essential information through animation alone

**No critical issues identified.** The app is fully usable with Reduce Motion enabled.

# Accessibility Testing Guide
**Project:** AthleadAI iOS App
**Last Updated:** 2025-10-05
**WCAG Level:** AA Compliance

## Overview
This guide provides comprehensive instructions for testing the accessibility features of the AthleadAI iOS app. Follow these procedures to ensure WCAG AA compliance is maintained across all updates.

## Quick Start Checklist

Before releasing any feature:
- [ ] Run automated accessibility tests (`AccessibilityTests.swift`)
- [ ] Test with VoiceOver enabled
- [ ] Test with largest accessibility text size
- [ ] Test with Reduce Motion enabled
- [ ] Verify color contrast in both light and dark modes
- [ ] Test with Xcode Accessibility Inspector

## Automated Testing

### Running Accessibility Tests

```bash
# From the iOS project directory
cd /Users/coreyyoung/Desktop/Projects/RecruitAI/apps/ios

# Run all accessibility tests
xcodebuild test -scheme athleadai -destination 'platform=iOS Simulator,name=iPhone 17' -only-testing:athleadaiTests/AccessibilityTests

# Run specific test
xcodebuild test -scheme athleadai -destination 'platform=iOS Simulator,name=iPhone 17' -only-testing:athleadaiTests/AccessibilityTests/testIconOnlyButtonsHaveLabels
```

### Test Coverage

The `AccessibilityTests.swift` file includes tests for:

1. **VoiceOver Labels** (6 tests)
   - Icon-only buttons
   - Profile images
   - Decorative elements
   - Card accessibility elements

2. **Dynamic Type** (2 tests)
   - Semantic font usage
   - Dynamic type size limits

3. **Color Contrast** (2 tests)
   - Semantic color usage
   - WCAG AA compliance ratios

4. **Reduce Motion** (2 tests)
   - Minimal custom animations
   - Essential information not animation-dependent

5. **Integration Tests** (3 tests)
   - Feed accessibility flow
   - Search accessibility flow
   - Profile accessibility flow

**Total:** 15+ comprehensive tests

## Manual Testing

### 1. VoiceOver Testing

#### Enable VoiceOver:
1. Settings > Accessibility > VoiceOver > On
2. OR: Triple-click side button (if configured)
3. OR: Ask Siri: "Turn on VoiceOver"

#### VoiceOver Gestures:
- **Swipe right:** Next element
- **Swipe left:** Previous element
- **Double tap:** Activate element
- **Two-finger tap:** Stop speaking
- **Three-finger swipe up/down:** Scroll

#### Test Scenarios:

**Feed View**
- [ ] Squad filter buttons are announced correctly
- [ ] "Add new squad" button is announced
- [ ] "Create new post" button is announced with hint
- [ ] Post content is readable
- [ ] Like/Comment/Share buttons have proper labels
- [ ] Author names and handles are combined logically

**Search View**
- [ ] Search field has placeholder text
- [ ] "Clear search" button is announced (when visible)
- [ ] "View statistics" and "View bookmarks" buttons have labels
- [ ] School/Coach cards read as single units
- [ ] Chevron icons are hidden from VoiceOver
- [ ] Filter chips have proper labels

**Profile View**
- [ ] "Go live" button is announced with hint
- [ ] "Settings" button is announced with hint
- [ ] Menu items read icon + title together
- [ ] Background profile image is hidden (decorative)

**Auth Flows**
- [ ] Logo images have descriptive labels
- [ ] All buttons have text (not icon-only)
- [ ] Form fields have proper labels

#### Expected Behavior:
- All interactive elements should be reachable
- Decorative elements should be skipped
- Compound elements (cards) should read as one unit
- All actions should be clear and actionable

### 2. Dynamic Type Testing

#### Enable Large Text:
1. Settings > Accessibility > Display & Text Size > Larger Text
2. Drag slider to maximum
3. Test at these sizes:
   - Default
   - Accessibility 1 (xxxLarge)
   - Accessibility 5 (maximum)

#### Test Scenarios:

**All Views**
- [ ] Text scales proportionally
- [ ] No text truncation occurs
- [ ] Layouts adjust to accommodate larger text
- [ ] Buttons remain tappable
- [ ] Cards expand vertically as needed

**Specific Elements**
- [ ] "AthleadAI" title on SignInView scales but limits to xxxLarge
- [ ] "ATHLEAD" title on UserTypeSelectionView scales properly
- [ ] School initials in SearchView scale appropriately
- [ ] All body text is readable

#### Expected Behavior:
- Text should scale smoothly up to Accessibility 5
- Large titles should limit to prevent overflow (xxxLarge or accessibility1)
- Layouts should remain usable (no overlapping text)
- Scrolling should work for expanded content

### 3. Color Contrast Testing

#### Enable Increased Contrast:
1. Settings > Accessibility > Display & Text Size > Increase Contrast
2. Test both enabled and disabled states

#### Test Scenarios:

**Light Mode**
- [ ] All text is readable on backgrounds
- [ ] Interactive elements stand out
- [ ] Disabled states are distinguishable

**Dark Mode**
- [ ] White text on gradients is crisp
- [ ] Gray supporting text is readable
- [ ] Blue interactive elements are visible
- [ ] Error states (red) are clear

#### Tools:
- **Xcode Accessibility Inspector:** View > Show Accessibility Inspector
- **Color Contrast Analyzer:** External desktop app
- **Manual check:** View color-contrast-audit.md

#### Minimum Requirements:
- Normal text (< 18pt): 4.5:1 ratio
- Large text (â‰¥ 18pt): 3:1 ratio
- UI components: 3:1 ratio

### 4. Reduce Motion Testing

#### Enable Reduce Motion:
1. Settings > Accessibility > Motion > Reduce Motion

#### Test Scenarios:

**Navigation**
- [ ] Tab switches are smooth (no bounce)
- [ ] Sheet presentations are simple
- [ ] NavigationStack pushes are cross-fades
- [ ] No parallax effects

**App Launch**
- [ ] Splash screen appears (minimal animation)
- [ ] No jarring motion

**UI Feedback**
- [ ] Button presses work (subtle or no animation)
- [ ] Sheet dismissals are simple
- [ ] All functionality remains accessible

#### Expected Behavior:
- Animations should be dampened or replaced with fades
- App should remain fully functional
- No essential information lost
- Transitions should be quick and simple

### 5. Keyboard Navigation Testing

#### External Keyboard:
1. Connect bluetooth keyboard to iOS device
2. Test navigation with Tab key
3. Test activation with Space/Return

#### Test Scenarios:
- [ ] All interactive elements are reachable via Tab
- [ ] Tab order is logical
- [ ] Focus indicator is visible
- [ ] Space/Return activates buttons
- [ ] Esc dismisses modals

## Xcode Accessibility Inspector

### Opening the Inspector:
1. Run app in Simulator
2. Xcode > Open Developer Tool > Accessibility Inspector
3. Select your simulator from the target dropdown

### Inspection Checklist:

**Audit Tab**
- [ ] Run full audit
- [ ] Fix any warnings or errors
- [ ] Pay attention to:
  - Minimum size violations
  - Contrast issues
  - Missing labels
  - Dynamic Type issues

**Element Tab**
- [ ] Inspect each screen
- [ ] Verify labels are descriptive
- [ ] Check that traits are correct
- [ ] Ensure actions are available

**Simulation Tools**
- [ ] Test with Bold Text enabled
- [ ] Test with Button Shapes enabled
- [ ] Test with reduced transparency

## Continuous Integration

### Adding Tests to CI:
```yaml
# .github/workflows/ios-tests.yml
- name: Run Accessibility Tests
  run: |
    xcodebuild test \
      -scheme athleadai \
      -destination 'platform=iOS Simulator,name=iPhone 17' \
      -only-testing:athleadaiTests/AccessibilityTests
```

### Pre-commit Checks:
- Accessibility tests must pass
- No new accessibility warnings in Xcode
- No hardcoded font sizes (use semantic styles)
- No hardcoded hex colors (use semantic colors)

## Common Issues & Solutions

### Issue: "Button not accessible with VoiceOver"
**Solution:** Add `.accessibilityLabel("Description")`

### Issue: "Text truncates at large sizes"
**Solution:**
1. Use `.fixedSize(horizontal: false, vertical: true)`
2. Add `.lineLimit(nil)` for multiline text
3. Add `.dynamicTypeSize(...DynamicTypeSize.xxxLarge)` to limit

### Issue: "Low contrast warning"
**Solution:**
1. Use semantic colors (`.primary`, `.secondary`)
2. Avoid gray on gray combinations
3. Test in both light and dark modes

### Issue: "Animation too intense for reduce motion"
**Solution:**
```swift
@Environment(\.accessibilityReduceMotion) var reduceMotion

withAnimation(reduceMotion ? nil : .spring()) {
    // animation code
}
```

## Testing Schedule

### Every PR:
- [ ] Run automated accessibility tests
- [ ] Quick VoiceOver check on changed screens

### Before Release:
- [ ] Full manual VoiceOver testing
- [ ] Dynamic Type testing at all sizes
- [ ] Color contrast verification
- [ ] Reduce Motion testing
- [ ] Accessibility Inspector audit

### Quarterly:
- [ ] Full WCAG AA compliance audit
- [ ] Update this testing guide
- [ ] Review and update automated tests
- [ ] User testing with accessibility users

## Resources

### Apple Documentation:
- [Accessibility for iOS](https://developer.apple.com/accessibility/ios/)
- [Human Interface Guidelines - Accessibility](https://developer.apple.com/design/human-interface-guidelines/accessibility)
- [SwiftUI Accessibility](https://developer.apple.com/documentation/swiftui/view-accessibility)

### WCAG Guidelines:
- [WCAG 2.1 AA](https://www.w3.org/WAI/WCAG21/quickref/?currentsidebar=%23col_customize&levels=aa)

### Tools:
- [Color Contrast Analyzer](https://www.tpgi.com/color-contrast-checker/)
- [WebAIM Contrast Checker](https://webaim.org/resources/contrastchecker/)

## Accessibility Champion

If you have questions about accessibility testing:
1. Check this guide first
2. Review the audit documents in `docs/accessibility/`
3. Run the Accessibility Inspector
4. Consult Apple's documentation

## Success Metrics

Our app should maintain:
- âœ… 100% VoiceOver labels on interactive elements
- âœ… 100% Dynamic Type support (semantic fonts)
- âœ… 100% WCAG AA color contrast compliance
- âœ… Minimal custom animations (<5 instances)
- âœ… 95%+ accessibility test coverage

**Current Status:** âœ… All metrics met (as of 2025-10-05)

---

**Document Version:** 1.0
**Next Review:** 2026-01-05

```swift
import SwiftUI

/// A glass-morphism card with blur effect and border
/// Uses DesignTheme colors for consistent styling
struct GlassCard<Content: View>: View {
    let content: Content
    var cornerRadius: CGFloat = .radiusLarge
    var padding: CGFloat = .spacing4

    @Environment(\.designTheme) private var theme
    @Environment(\.colorScheme) private var colorScheme

    init(
        cornerRadius: CGFloat = .radiusLarge,
        padding: CGFloat = .spacing4,
        @ViewBuilder content: () -> Content
    ) {
        self.cornerRadius = cornerRadius
        self.padding = padding
        self.content = content()
    }

    var body: some View {
        content
            .padding(padding)
            .background(
                RoundedRectangle(cornerRadius: cornerRadius, style: .continuous)
                    .fill(theme.color(.card))
                    .overlay(
                        RoundedRectangle(cornerRadius: cornerRadius, style: .continuous)
                            .stroke(theme.color(.border).opacity(0.3), lineWidth: 1)
                    )
            )
    }
}

// ViewModifier version
struct GlassCardModifier: ViewModifier {
    var cornerRadius: CGFloat = .radiusLarge

    @Environment(\.designTheme) private var theme

    func body(content: Content) -> some View {
        content
            .background(
                RoundedRectangle(cornerRadius: cornerRadius, style: .continuous)
                    .fill(theme.color(.card))
                    .overlay(
                        RoundedRectangle(cornerRadius: cornerRadius, style: .continuous)
                            .stroke(theme.color(.border).opacity(0.3), lineWidth: 1)
                    )
            )
    }
}

extension View {
    func glassCard(cornerRadius: CGFloat = .radiusLarge) -> some View {
        modifier(GlassCardModifier(cornerRadius: cornerRadius))
    }
}
```

```swift
            .font(theme.font(.body))
            .foregroundStyle(theme.color(.cardforeground))
    }
}

// Modifier version

    Text("Hello")
}

```

```swift
import SwiftUI

// MARK: - Enhanced DSButton with Icons & Loading
extension DSButton {
    /// Enhanced button with icon and loading state support
    init(
        _ title: String,
        icon: String? = nil,
        intent: Intent = .primary,
        size: Size = .m,
        isLoading: Bool = false,
        action: @escaping () -> Void
    ) {
        self.title = title
        self.intent = intent
        self.size = size
        self.isLoading = isLoading
        self.icon = icon
        self.action = {
            // Add haptic feedback
            UIImpactFeedbackGenerator(style: .medium).impactOccurred()
            action()
        }
    }
}

// MARK: - App-Specific Button Wrapper
struct BrandButton: View {
    let title: String
    let icon: String?
    let style: ButtonStyle
    let isLoading: Bool
    let action: () -> Void

    enum ButtonStyle {
        case primary
        case secondary
        case destructive
        case outline

        var dsIntent: DSButton.Intent {
            switch self {
            case .primary: return .primary
            case .secondary: return .secondary
            case .destructive: return .destructive
            case .outline: return .secondary // Will customize
            }
        }
    }

    @Environment(\.isEnabled) private var isEnabled
    @Environment(\.designTheme) private var theme

    init(
        title: String,
        icon: String? = nil,
        style: ButtonStyle = .primary,
        isLoading: Bool = false,
        action: @escaping () -> Void
    ) {
        self.title = title
        self.icon = icon
        self.style = style
        self.isLoading = isLoading
        self.action = action
    }

    var body: some View {
        if style == .outline {
            // Custom outline style
            outlineButton
        } else {
            // Use DSButton for standard styles
            DSButton(
                title,
                icon: icon,
                intent: style.dsIntent,
                isLoading: isLoading,
                action: action
            )
        }
    }

    private var outlineButton: some View {
        Button(action: {
            UIImpactFeedbackGenerator(style: .medium).impactOccurred()
            action()
        }) {
            HStack(spacing: .spacing3) {
                if isLoading {
                    ProgressView()
                        .tint(theme.color(.primary))
                } else {
                    if let icon = icon {
                        Image(systemName: icon)
                    }
                    Text(title)
                        .font(theme.font(.body))
                }
            }
            .frame(maxWidth: .infinity)
            .padding()
            .foregroundStyle(theme.color(.primary))
            .background(
                RoundedRectangle(cornerRadius: .radiusLarge, style: .continuous)
                    .stroke(theme.color(.primary), lineWidth: 2)
            )
        }
        .disabled(!isEnabled || isLoading)
        .opacity(isEnabled ? 1.0 : 0.5)
        .accessibilityLabel(title)
    }
}
```

```swift
enum BackgroundStyle {
    case auth
    case feed

struct BrandBackground: View {

        Group {
```

### 2.2a Enhance MVVM with Access Control & Best Practices âœ… COMPLETED

**Goal:** Refine existing ViewModels to follow Hacking with Swift best practices for better encapsulation and API design.

**Based on:** [Hacking with Swift - Introducing MVVM](https://www.hackingwithswift.com/books/ios-swiftui/introducing-mvvm-into-your-swiftui-project)

**Current State:**
- âœ… ViewModels created and integrated (FeedViewModel, SearchViewModel)
- âŒ Properties are publicly mutable (not encapsulated)
- âŒ No clear API surface for state mutations
- âŒ Missing automatic persistence patterns

**Key Improvements from HWS:**

1. **Access Control with `private(set)`**
   - Make state properties read-only from outside
   - Force mutations through methods for better control
   - Clearer API surface for consumers

2. **Controlled Mutations**
   - All state changes go through methods
   - Easier to add side effects (analytics, logging, persistence)
   - Better testability

3. **Practical MVVM**
   - "There is no single definition of MVVM" - be flexible
   - Don't move everything - simple state can stay in views
   - Focus on testability as the main benefit

**Implementation:**

**Before (Current Pattern):**
```swift

class FeedViewModel {
    var posts: [FeedPost] = []  // Publicly mutable âŒ
    var isLoading = false
    var selectedFilter: FeedFilter = .all

    func loadFeed() async {
        isLoading = true  // Direct mutation
        // ...
    }
}

// Usage in View:
viewModel.posts.append(newPost)  // Can mutate directly âŒ
```

**After (HWS Pattern with private(set)):**
```swift

class FeedViewModel {
    // MARK: - Published State (read-only from outside)
    private(set) var posts: [FeedPost] = []  âœ…
    private(set) var isLoading = false
    private(set) var error: Error?

    // MARK: - User-controlled State (can be modified by view)
    var selectedFilter: FeedFilter = .all
    var showCreatePost = false

        case .all: return posts
        case .squad(let name): return posts.filter { $0.squad == name }
        // ... other filters
        }
    }

    // MARK: - Actions (controlled mutations)
    func loadFeed() async {
        isLoading = true  âœ… Only ViewModel can set this
        error = nil

        do {
            let fetchedPosts = try await fetchPosts()
            posts = fetchedPosts  âœ… Controlled mutation
            isLoading = false
        } catch {
            self.error = error
            isLoading = false
        }
    }

    func selectSquad(_ squad: String?) {
        selectedFilter = squad.map { .squad($0) } ?? .all
        Task { await loadFeed() }
    }

    func toggleCreatePost() {
        showCreatePost.toggle()
    }

    func addPost(_ post: FeedPost) {
        posts.insert(post, at: 0)  âœ… Controlled mutation
        saveToCache()  // Easy to add side effects
    }

    // MARK: - Private Helpers
    private func fetchPosts() async throws -> [FeedPost] {
        // API call
        []
    }

    private func saveToCache() {
        // Automatic persistence (HWS pattern)
    }
}

// Usage in View:
// viewModel.posts.append(newPost)  âŒ Compile error!
viewModel.addPost(newPost)  âœ… Must use method
```

**Benefits:**

1. **Encapsulation**
   - State can only be modified through well-defined methods
   - Prevents accidental mutations from views
   - Clear contract between View and ViewModel

2. **Testability**

   ```swift
       XCTAssertFalse(vm.posts.isEmpty)
   ```

3. **Side Effects**
   - Easy to add analytics, logging, caching
   - All mutations go through methods

   ```swift
   viewModel.loadFeed()           âœ… Action
   viewModel.selectSquad("Carroll") âœ… Action
   viewModel.filteredPosts         âœ… Read data
   ```

```swift
struct CircleFilter: View {
    let name: String
    let icon: String?
    let imageName: String?
    let iconColor: Color
    let isSelected: Bool
    let action: () -> Void

    init(
        name: String,
        icon: String? = nil,
        imageName: String? = nil,
        iconColor: Color = .blue,
        isSelected: Bool = false,
        action: @escaping () -> Void
    ) {
        self.name = name
        self.icon = icon
        self.imageName = imageName
        self.iconColor = iconColor
        self.isSelected = isSelected
        self.action = action
    }

    var body: some View {
        Button(action: action) {
            VStack(spacing: .spacing2) {
                // Circle with content
                ZStack {
                    // Outer ring
                    Circle()
                        .strokeBorder(
                            LinearGradient(
                                colors: isSelected
                                    ? [iconColor, iconColor.opacity(0.6)]
                                    : [Color.white.opacity(0.3), Color.white.opacity(0.3)],
                                startPoint: .topLeading,
                                endPoint: .bottomTrailing
                            ),
                            lineWidth: 3
                        )
                        .frame(width: 70, height: 70)

                    // Inner circle
                    Circle()
                        .fill(
                            LinearGradient(
                                colors: isSelected
                                    ? [iconColor.opacity(0.3), iconColor.opacity(0.2)]
                                    : [Color.white.opacity(0.2), Color.white.opacity(0.1)],
                                startPoint: .topLeading,
                                endPoint: .bottomTrailing
                            )
                        )
                        .frame(width: 64, height: 64)

                    // Content (image or icon)
                    if let imageName = imageName {
                        Image(imageName)
                            .resizable()
                            .scaledToFill()
                            .frame(width: 64, height: 64)
                            .clipShape(Circle())
                    } else if let icon = icon {
                        Image(systemName: icon)
                            .font(.system(size: 28))
                            .foregroundColor(isSelected ? iconColor : .gray)
                    }
                }

                // Name label
                Text(name)
                    .font(.caption)
                    .fontWeight(isSelected ? .semibold : .regular)
                    .foregroundColor(isSelected ? .white : .gray)
                    .lineLimit(1)
            }
            .frame(width: 80)
        }
        .accessibilityLabel("\(name) filter")
        .accessibilityAddTraits(isSelected ? .isSelected : [])
        .accessibilityHint(isSelected ? "Currently selected" : "Double tap to select")
    }
}
```

```swift
import SwiftUI

struct MenuItem<Destination: View>: View {
    let icon: String
    let title: String
    let iconColor: Color
    let destination: Destination?
    let action: (() -> Void)?

    init(
        icon: String,
        title: String,
        iconColor: Color = .brandPrimary,
        destination: Destination
    ) where Destination: View {
        self.icon = icon
        self.title = title
        self.iconColor = iconColor
        self.destination = destination
        self.action = nil
    }

    init(
        icon: String,
        title: String,
        iconColor: Color = .brandPrimary,
        action: @escaping () -> Void
    ) where Destination == EmptyView {
        self.icon = icon
        self.title = title
        self.iconColor = iconColor
        self.destination = nil
        self.action = action
    }

    var body: some View {
        Group {
            if let destination = destination {
                NavigationLink(destination: destination) {
                    content
                }
            } else {
                Button(action: action ?? {}) {
                    content
                }
            }
        }
        .accessibilityElement(combining: .children)
        .accessibilityLabel(title)
        .accessibilityHint("Navigate to \(title)")
    }

    private var content: some View {
        HStack(spacing: .spacing4) {
            Image(systemName: icon)
                .foregroundColor(.white)
                .frame(width: 36, height: 36)
                .background(iconColor)
                .clipShape(Circle())
                .accessibilityHidden(true)

            Text(title)
                .font(.cardTitle)
                .foregroundColor(.primary)

            Spacer()

            Image(systemName: "chevron.right")
                .foregroundColor(.secondary)
                .font(.caption)
                .accessibilityHidden(true)
        }
        .padding(.spacing4)
    }
}
```

```swift
import SwiftUI

enum UserType: String, Codable {
    case athlete = "Athlete"
    case clubCoach = "Club Coach"
    case collegeCoach = "College Coach"
    case parent = "Parent"

    var accentColor: Color {
        switch self {
        case .athlete:
            return .blue
        case .clubCoach:
            return .orange
        case .collegeCoach:
            return .red
        case .parent:
            return .green
        }
    }

    var gradientColors: [Color] {
        switch self {
        case .athlete:
            return [.blue, .purple]
        case .clubCoach:
            return [.orange, Color(red: 1.0, green: 0.4, blue: 0.0)]
        case .collegeCoach:
            return [.red, Color(red: 1.0, green: 0.2, blue: 0.4)]
        case .parent:
            return [.green, .teal]
        }
    }

    var gradient: LinearGradient {
        LinearGradient(
            colors: gradientColors,
            startPoint: .topLeading,
            endPoint: .bottomTrailing
        )
    }
}

// Environment key
struct UserTypeKey: EnvironmentKey {
    static let defaultValue: UserType = .athlete
}

extension EnvironmentValues {
    var userType: UserType {
        get { self[UserTypeKey.self] }
        set { self[UserTypeKey.self] = newValue }
    }
}
```

```swift
struct ButtonPressModifier: ViewModifier {
    @State private var isPressed = false
    @Environment(\.accessibilityReduceMotion) var reduceMotion

    func body(content: Content) -> some View {
        content
            .scaleEffect(isPressed && !reduceMotion ? 0.95 : 1.0)
            .opacity(isPressed ? 0.8 : 1.0)
            .gesture(
                DragGesture(minimumDistance: 0)
                    .onChanged { _ in
                        if !isPressed {
                            isPressed = true
                            UIImpactFeedbackGenerator(style: .medium).impactOccurred()
                        }
                    }
                    .onEnded { _ in
                        isPressed = false
                    }
            )
    }
}

extension View {
    func buttonPressEffect() -> some View {
        modifier(ButtonPressModifier())
    }
}
```

```swift
import SwiftUI

/// A glass-morphism card with blur effect and border
/// Uses DesignTheme colors for consistent styling
struct GlassCard<Content: View>: View {
    let content: Content
    var cornerRadius: CGFloat = .radiusLarge
    var padding: CGFloat = .spacing4

    @Environment(\.designTheme) private var theme
    @Environment(\.colorScheme) private var colorScheme

    init(
        cornerRadius: CGFloat = .radiusLarge,
        padding: CGFloat = .spacing4,
        @ViewBuilder content: () -> Content
    ) {
        self.cornerRadius = cornerRadius
        self.padding = padding
        self.content = content()
    }

    var body: some View {
        content
            .padding(padding)
            .background(
                RoundedRectangle(cornerRadius: cornerRadius, style: .continuous)
                    .fill(theme.color(.card))
                    .overlay(
                        RoundedRectangle(cornerRadius: cornerRadius, style: .continuous)
                            .stroke(theme.color(.border).opacity(0.3), lineWidth: 1)
                    )
            )
    }
}

// ViewModifier version
struct GlassCardModifier: ViewModifier {
    var cornerRadius: CGFloat = .radiusLarge

    @Environment(\.designTheme) private var theme

    func body(content: Content) -> some View {
        content
            .background(
                RoundedRectangle(cornerRadius: cornerRadius, style: .continuous)
                    .fill(theme.color(.card))
                    .overlay(
                        RoundedRectangle(cornerRadius: cornerRadius, style: .continuous)
                            .stroke(theme.color(.border).opacity(0.3), lineWidth: 1)
                    )
            )
    }
}

extension View {
    func glassCard(cornerRadius: CGFloat = .radiusLarge) -> some View {
        modifier(GlassCardModifier(cornerRadius: cornerRadius))
    }
}
```

```swift
        case outline

            case .destructive: return .destructive

    init(

        icon: String? = nil,

        isLoading: Bool = false,

        self.icon = icon
        self.style = style
        self.isLoading = isLoading
        self.action = action
    }

            outlineButton
        } else {
```

### 2.2a Enhance MVVM with Access Control & Best Practices âœ… COMPLETED

**Goal:** Refine existing ViewModels to follow Hacking with Swift best practices for better encapsulation and API design.

**Based on:** [Hacking with Swift - Introducing MVVM](https://www.hackingwithswift.com/books/ios-swiftui/introducing-mvvm-into-your-swiftui-project)

**Current State:**
- âœ… ViewModels created and integrated (FeedViewModel, SearchViewModel)
- âŒ Properties are publicly mutable (not encapsulated)
- âŒ No clear API surface for state mutations
- âŒ Missing automatic persistence patterns

**Key Improvements from HWS:**

1. **Access Control with `private(set)`**
   - Make state properties read-only from outside
   - Force mutations through methods for better control
   - Clearer API surface for consumers

2. **Controlled Mutations**
   - All state changes go through methods
   - Easier to add side effects (analytics, logging, persistence)
   - Better testability

3. **Practical MVVM**
   - "There is no single definition of MVVM" - be flexible
   - Don't move everything - simple state can stay in views
   - Focus on testability as the main benefit

**Implementation:**

**Before (Current Pattern):**

```swift
    var posts: [FeedPost] = []  // Publicly mutable âŒ
```

```swift
    // MARK: - Published State (read-only from outside)
    private(set) var posts: [FeedPost] = []  âœ…
```

```swift
import SwiftUI

struct MenuItem<Destination: View>: View {
    let icon: String
    let title: String
    let iconColor: Color
    let destination: Destination?
    let action: (() -> Void)?

    init(
        icon: String,
        title: String,
        iconColor: Color = .brandPrimary,
        destination: Destination
    ) where Destination: View {
        self.icon = icon
        self.title = title
        self.iconColor = iconColor
        self.destination = destination
        self.action = nil
    }

    init(
        icon: String,
        title: String,
        iconColor: Color = .brandPrimary,
        action: @escaping () -> Void
    ) where Destination == EmptyView {
        self.icon = icon
        self.title = title
        self.iconColor = iconColor
        self.destination = nil
        self.action = action
    }

        Group {
```

```swift
import SwiftUI

enum UserType: String, Codable {
    case athlete = "Athlete"
    case clubCoach = "Club Coach"
    case collegeCoach = "College Coach"
    case parent = "Parent"

    var accentColor: Color {
        switch self {
        case .athlete:
            return .blue
        case .clubCoach:
            return .orange
        case .collegeCoach:
            return .red
        case .parent:
            return .green
        }
    }

    var gradientColors: [Color] {
        switch self {
        case .athlete:
            return [.blue, .purple]
        case .clubCoach:
            return [.orange, Color(red: 1.0, green: 0.4, blue: 0.0)]
        case .collegeCoach:
            return [.red, Color(red: 1.0, green: 0.2, blue: 0.4)]
        case .parent:
            return [.green, .teal]
        }
    }

    var gradient: LinearGradient {
        LinearGradient(
            colors: gradientColors,
            startPoint: .topLeading,
            endPoint: .bottomTrailing
        )
    }
}

// Environment key
struct UserTypeKey: EnvironmentKey {
    static let defaultValue: UserType = .athlete
}

extension EnvironmentValues {
    var userType: UserType {
        get { self[UserTypeKey.self] }
        set { self[UserTypeKey.self] = newValue }
    }
}
```

**Implementation:**
```swift
import SwiftUI

struct StatItem {
    let value: String
    let label: String
    let icon: String?
}

struct StatsBar: View {
    let stats: [StatItem]
    var style: StatsStyle = .horizontal

    enum StatsStyle {
        case horizontal
        case vertical
    }

    var body: some View {
        Group {
            switch style {
            case .horizontal:
                horizontalLayout
            case .vertical:
                verticalLayout
            }
        }
    }

    private var horizontalLayout: some View {
        HStack(spacing: 0) {
            ForEach(Array(stats.enumerated()), id: \.offset) { index, stat in
                StatItemView(stat: stat)
                    .frame(maxWidth: .infinity)

                if index < stats.count - 1 {
                    Divider()
                }
            }
        }
        .glassCard()
    }

    private var verticalLayout: some View {
        VStack(spacing: .spacing3) {
            ForEach(Array(stats.enumerated()), id: \.offset) { index, stat in
                StatItemView(stat: stat, isVertical: true)

                if index < stats.count - 1 {
                    Divider()
                }
            }
        }
        .glassCard()
    }
}

struct StatItemView: View {
    let stat: StatItem
    var isVertical: Bool = false

    var body: some View {
        VStack(spacing: .spacing2) {
            if let icon = stat.icon {
                Image(systemName: icon)
                    .font(.caption)
                    .foregroundColor(.brandPrimary)
                    .accessibilityHidden(true)
            }

            Text(stat.value)
                .font(.title3)
                .fontWeight(.bold)
                .foregroundColor(.primary)

            Text(stat.label)
                .font(.caption)
                .foregroundColor(.secondary)
        }
        .padding(.spacing3)
        .frame(maxWidth: isVertical ? .infinity : nil, alignment: isVertical ? .leading : .center)
        .accessibilityElement(combining: .children)
        .accessibilityLabel("\(stat.value) \(stat.label)")
    }
}
```

```swift
struct ButtonPressModifier: ViewModifier {
    @State private var isPressed = false
    @Environment(\.accessibilityReduceMotion) var reduceMotion

    func body(content: Content) -> some View {
        content
            .scaleEffect(isPressed && !reduceMotion ? 0.95 : 1.0)
            .opacity(isPressed ? 0.8 : 1.0)
            .gesture(
                DragGesture(minimumDistance: 0)
                    .onChanged { _ in
                        if !isPressed {
                            isPressed = true
                            UIImpactFeedbackGenerator(style: .medium).impactOccurred()
                        }
                    }
                    .onEnded { _ in
                        isPressed = false
                    }
            )
    }
}

extension View {
    func buttonPressEffect() -> some View {
        modifier(ButtonPressModifier())
    }
}
```

## Risk Management

### Identified Risks

1. **Scope Creep**
   - *Risk:* Adding features instead of focusing on design system
   - *Mitigation:* Strict adherence to plan, no new features
   - *Impact:* High
   - *Likelihood:* Medium

2. **Breaking Changes**
   - *Risk:* Refactoring breaks existing functionality
   - *Mitigation:* Incremental changes, thorough testing
   - *Impact:* High
   - *Likelihood:* Medium

3. **Time Constraints**
   - *Risk:* Tasks take longer than estimated
   - *Mitigation:* Buffer week built in, prioritize critical items
   - *Impact:* Medium
   - *Likelihood:* High

4. **Accessibility Complexity**
   - *Risk:* Accessibility testing reveals more work than expected
   - *Mitigation:* Start early, dedicate full week
   - *Impact:* Medium
   - *Likelihood:* Medium

5. **Device Coverage**
   - *Risk:* Not enough devices for thorough testing
   - *Mitigation:* Use simulator + TestFlight beta
   - *Impact:* Low
   - *Likelihood:* Low

### Contingency Plans

- Maintain accessibility as non-negotiable

**If breaking changes occur:**

```swift
import SwiftUI

/// A glass-morphism card with blur effect and border
/// Uses DesignTheme colors for consistent styling
struct GlassCard<Content: View>: View {
    let content: Content
    var cornerRadius: CGFloat = .radiusLarge
    var padding: CGFloat = .spacing4

    @Environment(\.designTheme) private var theme
    @Environment(\.colorScheme) private var colorScheme

    init(
        cornerRadius: CGFloat = .radiusLarge,
        padding: CGFloat = .spacing4,
        @ViewBuilder content: () -> Content
    ) {
        self.cornerRadius = cornerRadius
        self.padding = padding
        self.content = content()
    }

    var body: some View {
        content
            .padding(padding)
            .background(
                RoundedRectangle(cornerRadius: cornerRadius, style: .continuous)
                    .fill(theme.color(.card))
                    .overlay(
                        RoundedRectangle(cornerRadius: cornerRadius, style: .continuous)
                            .stroke(theme.color(.border).opacity(0.3), lineWidth: 1)
                    )
            )
    }
}

// ViewModifier version
struct GlassCardModifier: ViewModifier {
    var cornerRadius: CGFloat = .radiusLarge

    @Environment(\.designTheme) private var theme

    func body(content: Content) -> some View {
        content
            .background(
                RoundedRectangle(cornerRadius: cornerRadius, style: .continuous)
                    .fill(theme.color(.card))
                    .overlay(
                        RoundedRectangle(cornerRadius: cornerRadius, style: .continuous)
                            .stroke(theme.color(.border).opacity(0.3), lineWidth: 1)
                    )
            )
    }
}

extension View {
    func glassCard(cornerRadius: CGFloat = .radiusLarge) -> some View {
        modifier(GlassCardModifier(cornerRadius: cornerRadius))
    }
}
```

## Phase 4: Polish & Refinement (Week 4)

**Goal:** Add final polish, user type theming, and advanced features

### 4.1 Implement User Type Theming â±ï¸ 4 hours

**Tasks:**

**Implementation:**

**File:** `apps/ios/athleadai/Models/UserType.swift`
```swift
import SwiftUI

enum UserType: String, Codable {
    case athlete = "Athlete"
    case clubCoach = "Club Coach"
    case collegeCoach = "College Coach"
    case parent = "Parent"

    var accentColor: Color {
        switch self {
        case .athlete:
            return .blue
        case .clubCoach:
            return .orange
        case .collegeCoach:
            return .red
        case .parent:
            return .green
        }
    }

    var gradientColors: [Color] {
        switch self {
        case .athlete:
            return [.blue, .purple]
        case .clubCoach:
            return [.orange, Color(red: 1.0, green: 0.4, blue: 0.0)]
        case .collegeCoach:
            return [.red, Color(red: 1.0, green: 0.2, blue: 0.4)]
        case .parent:
            return [.green, .teal]
        }
    }

    var gradient: LinearGradient {
        LinearGradient(
            colors: gradientColors,
            startPoint: .topLeading,
            endPoint: .bottomTrailing
        )
    }
}

// Environment key
struct UserTypeKey: EnvironmentKey {
    static let defaultValue: UserType = .athlete
}

extension EnvironmentValues {
    var userType: UserType {
        get { self[UserTypeKey.self] }
        set { self[UserTypeKey.self] = newValue }
    }
}
```

**Update DesignTokens.swift:**
```swift
extension LinearGradient {
    static func brandGradient(for userType: UserType) -> LinearGradient {
        userType.gradient
    }
}
```

```swift
    var body: some View {

    }
}
```

```swift
import SwiftUI

struct LoadingView: View {
    let message: String
    var size: LoadingSize = .medium

    enum LoadingSize {
        case small, medium, large

        var scale: CGFloat {
            switch self {
            case .small: return 1.0
            case .medium: return 1.5
            case .large: return 2.0

    var body: some View {

                .tint(.brandPrimary)
                .accessibilityHidden(true)

                .font(.bodyText)
                .foregroundColor(.secondary)
                .multilineTextAlignment(.center)
        }
        .frame(maxWidth: .infinity, maxHeight: .infinity)

        .accessibilityLabel("\(message), loading")
    }
}
```

```swift
import SwiftUI

struct SearchBar: View {
    @Binding var text: String
    let placeholder: String
    var onCommit: (() -> Void)?

    @FocusState private var isFocused: Bool

    var body: some View {
        HStack(spacing: .spacing3) {
            Image(systemName: "magnifyingglass")
                .foregroundColor(.secondary)
                .accessibilityHidden(true)

            TextField(placeholder, text: $text)
                .foregroundColor(.primary)
                .focused($isFocused)
                .submitLabel(.search)
                .onSubmit {
                    onCommit?()
                }
                .accessibilityLabel("Search field")
                .accessibilityValue(text.isEmpty ? placeholder : text)

            if !text.isEmpty {
                Button {
                    text = ""
                } label: {
                    Image(systemName: "xmark.circle.fill")
                        .foregroundColor(.secondary)
                }
                .accessibilityLabel("Clear search")
            }
        }
        .padding(.spacing4)
        .background(Color(.systemGray6))
        .cornerRadius(.radiusMedium)
        .overlay(
            RoundedRectangle(cornerRadius: .radiusMedium)
                .stroke(isFocused ? Color.brandPrimary : Color.clear, lineWidth: 2)
        )
    }
}
```

**Implementation:**
```swift
import SwiftUI

struct StatItem {
    let value: String
    let label: String
    let icon: String?
}

struct StatsBar: View {
    let stats: [StatItem]
    var style: StatsStyle = .horizontal

    enum StatsStyle {
        case horizontal
        case vertical
    }

    var body: some View {
        Group {
            switch style {
            case .horizontal:
                horizontalLayout
            case .vertical:
                verticalLayout
            }
        }
    }

    private var horizontalLayout: some View {
        HStack(spacing: 0) {
            ForEach(Array(stats.enumerated()), id: \.offset) { index, stat in
                StatItemView(stat: stat)
                    .frame(maxWidth: .infinity)

                if index < stats.count - 1 {
                    Divider()
                }
            }
        }
        .glassCard()
    }

    private var verticalLayout: some View {
        VStack(spacing: .spacing3) {
            ForEach(Array(stats.enumerated()), id: \.offset) { index, stat in
                StatItemView(stat: stat, isVertical: true)

                if index < stats.count - 1 {
                    Divider()
                }
            }
        }
        .glassCard()
    }
}

struct StatItemView: View {
    let stat: StatItem
    var isVertical: Bool = false

    var body: some View {
        VStack(spacing: .spacing2) {
            if let icon = stat.icon {
                Image(systemName: icon)
                    .font(.caption)
                    .foregroundColor(.brandPrimary)
                    .accessibilityHidden(true)
            }

            Text(stat.value)
                .font(.title3)
                .fontWeight(.bold)
                .foregroundColor(.primary)

            Text(stat.label)
                .font(.caption)
                .foregroundColor(.secondary)
        }
        .padding(.spacing3)
        .frame(maxWidth: isVertical ? .infinity : nil, alignment: isVertical ? .leading : .center)
        .accessibilityElement(combining: .children)
        .accessibilityLabel("\(stat.value) \(stat.label)")
    }
}
```

```swift
struct ButtonPressModifier: ViewModifier {
    @State private var isPressed = false
    @Environment(\.accessibilityReduceMotion) var reduceMotion

    func body(content: Content) -> some View {
        content
            .scaleEffect(isPressed && !reduceMotion ? 0.95 : 1.0)
            .opacity(isPressed ? 0.8 : 1.0)
            .gesture(
                DragGesture(minimumDistance: 0)
                    .onChanged { _ in
                        if !isPressed {
                            isPressed = true
                            UIImpactFeedbackGenerator(style: .medium).impactOccurred()
                        }
                    }
                    .onEnded { _ in
                        isPressed = false
                    }
            )
    }
}

extension View {
    func buttonPressEffect() -> some View {
        modifier(ButtonPressModifier())
    }
}
```

struct PrivacySettings: Codable {
    var showFullName: Bool = true

    var showBirthday: Bool = false
    var showSocialMedia: Bool = true
    var showGuardianInfo: Bool = false
}

struct User: Identifiable, Codable {

```swift
import SwiftUI
```

```swift
/// A glass-morphism card with blur effect and border
/// Uses DesignTheme colors for consistent styling
struct GlassCard<Content: View>: View {
    let content: Content
    var cornerRadius: CGFloat = .radiusLarge
    var padding: CGFloat = .spacing4

    @Environment(\.designTheme) private var theme
    @Environment(\.colorScheme) private var colorScheme

    init(
        cornerRadius: CGFloat = .radiusLarge,
        padding: CGFloat = .spacing4,
        @ViewBuilder content: () -> Content
    ) {
        self.cornerRadius = cornerRadius
        self.padding = padding
        self.content = content()
    }

    var body: some View {
        content
            .padding(padding)
            .background(
                RoundedRectangle(cornerRadius: cornerRadius, style: .continuous)
                    .fill(theme.color(.card))
                    .overlay(
                        RoundedRectangle(cornerRadius: cornerRadius, style: .continuous)
                            .stroke(theme.color(.border).opacity(0.3), lineWidth: 1)
                    )
            )
    }
}

// ViewModifier version
struct GlassCardModifier: ViewModifier {
    var cornerRadius: CGFloat = .radiusLarge

    @Environment(\.designTheme) private var theme

    func body(content: Content) -> some View {
        content
            .background(
                RoundedRectangle(cornerRadius: cornerRadius, style: .continuous)
                    .fill(theme.color(.card))
                    .overlay(
                        RoundedRectangle(cornerRadius: cornerRadius, style: .continuous)
                            .stroke(theme.color(.border).opacity(0.3), lineWidth: 1)
                    )
            )
    }
}

extension View {
    func glassCard(cornerRadius: CGFloat = .radiusLarge) -> some View {
        modifier(GlassCardModifier(cornerRadius: cornerRadius))
    }
}
```

```swift
// MARK: - Enhanced DSButton with Icons & Loading
extension DSButton {
    /// Enhanced button with icon and loading state support
    init(
        _ title: String,
        icon: String? = nil,
        intent: Intent = .primary,
        size: Size = .m,

        action: @escaping () -> Void
    ) {

        self.intent = intent
        self.size = size
        self.isLoading = isLoading
        self.icon = icon
        self.action = {
            // Add haptic feedback
            UIImpactFeedbackGenerator(style: .medium).impactOccurred()
            action()

// MARK: - App-Specific Button Wrapper
struct BrandButton: View {
    let title: String
    let icon: String?
    let style: ButtonStyle
    let isLoading: Bool
    let action: () -> Void

    enum ButtonStyle {
        case primary
        case secondary
        case destructive
        case outline

        var dsIntent: DSButton.Intent {
            switch self {
            case .primary: return .primary
            case .secondary: return .secondary
            case .destructive: return .destructive
            case .outline: return .secondary // Will customize
            }
        }
    }

    @Environment(\.isEnabled) private var isEnabled
    @Environment(\.designTheme) private var theme

    init(
        title: String,
        icon: String? = nil,
        style: ButtonStyle = .primary,
        isLoading: Bool = false,
        action: @escaping () -> Void
    ) {
        self.title = title
        self.icon = icon
        self.style = style
        self.isLoading = isLoading
        self.action = action
    }

    var body: some View {
        if style == .outline {
            // Custom outline style
            outlineButton
        } else {
            // Use DSButton for standard styles
            DSButton(
                title,
                icon: icon,
                intent: style.dsIntent,
                isLoading: isLoading,
                action: action
            )
        }
```

### 2.2a Enhance MVVM with Access Control & Best Practices âœ… COMPLETED

**Goal:** Refine existing ViewModels to follow Hacking with Swift best practices for better encapsulation and API design.

**Based on:** [Hacking with Swift - Introducing MVVM](https://www.hackingwithswift.com/books/ios-swiftui/introducing-mvvm-into-your-swiftui-project)

**Current State:**
- âœ… ViewModels created and integrated (FeedViewModel, SearchViewModel)
- âŒ Properties are publicly mutable (not encapsulated)
- âŒ No clear API surface for state mutations
- âŒ Missing automatic persistence patterns

**Key Improvements from HWS:**

1. **Access Control with `private(set)`**
   - Make state properties read-only from outside
   - Force mutations through methods for better control
   - Clearer API surface for consumers

2. **Controlled Mutations**
   - All state changes go through methods
   - Easier to add side effects (analytics, logging, persistence)
   - Better testability

3. **Practical MVVM**
   - "There is no single definition of MVVM" - be flexible
   - Don't move everything - simple state can stay in views
   - Focus on testability as the main benefit

**Implementation:**

**Before (Current Pattern):**
```swift
@Observable
class FeedViewModel {
    var posts: [FeedPost] = []  // Publicly mutable âŒ
    var isLoading = false
    var selectedFilter: FeedFilter = .all

    func loadFeed() async {
        isLoading = true  // Direct mutation
        // ...
    }
}

// Usage in View:
viewModel.posts.append(newPost)  // Can mutate directly âŒ
```

**After (HWS Pattern with private(set)):**
```swift

    // MARK: - Published State (read-only from outside)
    private(set) var posts: [FeedPost] = []  âœ…
    private(set) var isLoading = false
    private(set) var error: Error?

        }

        isLoading = true  âœ… Only ViewModel can set this
        error = nil

            posts = fetchedPosts  âœ… Controlled mutation

    func addPost(_ post: FeedPost) {

    }

    // MARK: - Private Helpers
    private func fetchPosts() async throws -> [FeedPost] {
        // API call
        []
    }

}

// Usage in View:
// viewModel.posts.append(newPost)  âŒ Compile error!
viewModel.addPost(newPost)  âœ… Must use method
```

```swift
import SwiftUI
```

```swift
struct CircleFilter: View {
    let name: String
    let icon: String?
    let imageName: String?
    let iconColor: Color
    let isSelected: Bool
    let action: () -> Void

    init(
        name: String,
        icon: String? = nil,
        imageName: String? = nil,
        iconColor: Color = .blue,
        isSelected: Bool = false,
        action: @escaping () -> Void
    ) {
        self.name = name
        self.icon = icon
        self.imageName = imageName
        self.iconColor = iconColor
        self.isSelected = isSelected
        self.action = action
    }

    var body: some View {
        Button(action: action) {
            VStack(spacing: .spacing2) {
                // Circle with content
                ZStack {
                    // Outer ring
                    Circle()
                        .strokeBorder(
                            LinearGradient(
                                colors: isSelected
                                    ? [iconColor, iconColor.opacity(0.6)]
                                    : [Color.white.opacity(0.3), Color.white.opacity(0.3)],
                                startPoint: .topLeading,
                                endPoint: .bottomTrailing
                            ),
                            lineWidth: 3
                        )
                        .frame(width: 70, height: 70)

                    // Inner circle
                    Circle()
                        .fill(
                            LinearGradient(
                                colors: isSelected
                                    ? [iconColor.opacity(0.3), iconColor.opacity(0.2)]
                                    : [Color.white.opacity(0.2), Color.white.opacity(0.1)],
                                startPoint: .topLeading,
                                endPoint: .bottomTrailing
                            )
                        )
                        .frame(width: 64, height: 64)

                    // Content (image or icon)
                    if let imageName = imageName {
                        Image(imageName)
                            .resizable()
                            .scaledToFill()
                            .frame(width: 64, height: 64)
                            .clipShape(Circle())
                    } else if let icon = icon {
                        Image(systemName: icon)
                            .font(.system(size: 28))
                            .foregroundColor(isSelected ? iconColor : .gray)
                    }
                }

                // Name label
                Text(name)
                    .font(.caption)
                    .fontWeight(isSelected ? .semibold : .regular)
                    .foregroundColor(isSelected ? .white : .gray)
                    .lineLimit(1)
            }
            .frame(width: 80)
        }
        .accessibilityLabel("\(name) filter")
        .accessibilityAddTraits(isSelected ? .isSelected : [])
        .accessibilityHint(isSelected ? "Currently selected" : "Double tap to select")
    }
}
```

```swift
import SwiftUI
```

```swift
struct MenuItem<Destination: View>: View {
    let icon: String
    let title: String
    let iconColor: Color
    let destination: Destination?
    let action: (() -> Void)?

    init(
        icon: String,
        title: String,
        iconColor: Color = .brandPrimary,
        destination: Destination
    ) where Destination: View {
        self.icon = icon
        self.title = title
        self.iconColor = iconColor
        self.destination = destination
        self.action = nil
    }

    init(
        icon: String,
        title: String,
        iconColor: Color = .brandPrimary,
        action: @escaping () -> Void
    ) where Destination == EmptyView {
        self.icon = icon
        self.title = title
        self.iconColor = iconColor
        self.destination = nil
        self.action = action
    }

    var body: some View {
        Group {
            if let destination = destination {
                NavigationLink(destination: destination) {
                    content
                }
            } else {
                Button(action: action ?? {}) {
                    content
                }
            }
        }
        .accessibilityElement(combining: .children)
        .accessibilityLabel(title)
        .accessibilityHint("Navigate to \(title)")
    }

    private var content: some View {
        HStack(spacing: .spacing4) {
            Image(systemName: icon)
                .foregroundColor(.white)
                .frame(width: 36, height: 36)
                .background(iconColor)
                .clipShape(Circle())
                .accessibilityHidden(true)

            Text(title)
                .font(.cardTitle)
                .foregroundColor(.primary)

            Spacer()

            Image(systemName: "chevron.right")
                .foregroundColor(.secondary)
                .font(.caption)
                .accessibilityHidden(true)
        }
        .padding(.spacing4)
    }
}
```

```swift
import SwiftUI

enum UserType: String, Codable {
    case athlete = "Athlete"
    case clubCoach = "Club Coach"
    case collegeCoach = "College Coach"
    case parent = "Parent"

    var accentColor: Color {
        switch self {
        case .athlete:
            return .blue
        case .clubCoach:
            return .orange
        case .collegeCoach:
            return .red
        case .parent:
            return .green
        }
    }

    var gradientColors: [Color] {
        switch self {
        case .athlete:
            return [.blue, .purple]
        case .clubCoach:
            return [.orange, Color(red: 1.0, green: 0.4, blue: 0.0)]
        case .collegeCoach:
            return [.red, Color(red: 1.0, green: 0.2, blue: 0.4)]
        case .parent:
            return [.green, .teal]
        }
    }

    var gradient: LinearGradient {
        LinearGradient(
            colors: gradientColors,
            startPoint: .topLeading,
            endPoint: .bottomTrailing
        )
    }
}

// Environment key
struct UserTypeKey: EnvironmentKey {
    static let defaultValue: UserType = .athlete
}

extension EnvironmentValues {
    var userType: UserType {
        get { self[UserTypeKey.self] }
        set { self[UserTypeKey.self] = newValue }
    }
}
```

```swift
struct ButtonPressModifier: ViewModifier {
    @State private var isPressed = false
    @Environment(\.accessibilityReduceMotion) var reduceMotion

    func body(content: Content) -> some View {
        content
            .scaleEffect(isPressed && !reduceMotion ? 0.95 : 1.0)
            .opacity(isPressed ? 0.8 : 1.0)
            .gesture(
                DragGesture(minimumDistance: 0)
                    .onChanged { _ in
                        if !isPressed {
                            isPressed = true
                            UIImpactFeedbackGenerator(style: .medium).impactOccurred()
                        }
                    }
                    .onEnded { _ in
```

2. **Breaking Changes**
   - *Risk:* Refactoring breaks existing functionality
   - *Mitigation:* Incremental changes, thorough testing
   - *Impact:* High
   - *Likelihood:* Medium

3. **Time Constraints**
   - *Risk:* Tasks take longer than estimated
   - *Mitigation:* Buffer week built in, prioritize critical items
   - *Impact:* Medium
   - *Likelihood:* High

   - *Risk:* Accessibility testing reveals more work than expected

```swift
import SwiftUI
```

```swift
/// A glass-morphism card with blur effect and border
/// Uses DesignTheme colors for consistent styling
struct GlassCard<Content: View>: View {
    let content: Content
    var cornerRadius: CGFloat = .radiusLarge
    var padding: CGFloat = .spacing4

    @Environment(\.designTheme) private var theme
    @Environment(\.colorScheme) private var colorScheme

    init(
        cornerRadius: CGFloat = .radiusLarge,
        padding: CGFloat = .spacing4,
        @ViewBuilder content: () -> Content
    ) {
        self.cornerRadius = cornerRadius
        self.padding = padding
        self.content = content()
    }

    var body: some View {
        content
            .padding(padding)
            .background(
                RoundedRectangle(cornerRadius: cornerRadius, style: .continuous)
                    .fill(theme.color(.card))
                    .overlay(
                        RoundedRectangle(cornerRadius: cornerRadius, style: .continuous)
                            .stroke(theme.color(.border).opacity(0.3), lineWidth: 1)
                    )
            )
    }
}

// ViewModifier version
struct GlassCardModifier: ViewModifier {
    var cornerRadius: CGFloat = .radiusLarge

    @Environment(\.designTheme) private var theme

    func body(content: Content) -> some View {
        content
            .background(
                RoundedRectangle(cornerRadius: cornerRadius, style: .continuous)
                    .fill(theme.color(.card))
                    .overlay(
                        RoundedRectangle(cornerRadius: cornerRadius, style: .continuous)
                            .stroke(theme.color(.border).opacity(0.3), lineWidth: 1)
                    )
            )
    }
}

extension View {
    func glassCard(cornerRadius: CGFloat = .radiusLarge) -> some View {
        modifier(GlassCardModifier(cornerRadius: cornerRadius))
    }
}
```

```swift
import SwiftUI

// MARK: - Enhanced DSButton with Icons & Loading
extension DSButton {
    /// Enhanced button with icon and loading state support
    init(

        icon: String? = nil,
        intent: Intent = .primary,
        size: Size = .m,

        action: @escaping () -> Void
    ) {

        self.intent = intent
        self.size = size
        self.isLoading = isLoading
        self.icon = icon
        self.action = {
            // Add haptic feedback
            UIImpactFeedbackGenerator(style: .medium).impactOccurred()
            action()
        }
    }
}

// MARK: - App-Specific Button Wrapper
struct BrandButton: View {
    let title: String
    let icon: String?
    let style: ButtonStyle
    let isLoading: Bool
    let action: () -> Void

    enum ButtonStyle {
        case primary
        case secondary
        case destructive
        case outline

        var dsIntent: DSButton.Intent {
            switch self {
            case .primary: return .primary
            case .secondary: return .secondary
            case .destructive: return .destructive
            case .outline: return .secondary // Will customize
            }
        }
    }

    @Environment(\.isEnabled) private var isEnabled
    @Environment(\.designTheme) private var theme

    init(
        title: String,
        icon: String? = nil,
        style: ButtonStyle = .primary,
        isLoading: Bool = false,
        action: @escaping () -> Void
    ) {
        self.title = title
        self.icon = icon
        self.style = style
        self.isLoading = isLoading
        self.action = action
    }

    var body: some View {
        if style == .outline {
            // Custom outline style
            outlineButton
        } else {
            // Use DSButton for standard styles
            DSButton(
                title,
                icon: icon,
                intent: style.dsIntent,
                isLoading: isLoading,
                action: action
            )
        }
    }

    private var outlineButton: some View {
        Button(action: {
            UIImpactFeedbackGenerator(style: .medium).impactOccurred()
            action()
        }) {
            HStack(spacing: .spacing3) {
                if isLoading {
                    ProgressView()
                        .tint(theme.color(.primary))
                } else {
                    if let icon = icon {
                        Image(systemName: icon)
                    }
                    Text(title)
                        .font(theme.font(.body))
                }
            }
            .frame(maxWidth: .infinity)
            .padding()
            .foregroundStyle(theme.color(.primary))
            .background(
                RoundedRectangle(cornerRadius: .radiusLarge, style: .continuous)
                    .stroke(theme.color(.primary), lineWidth: 2)
            )
        }
        .disabled(!isEnabled || isLoading)
        .opacity(isEnabled ? 1.0 : 0.5)
        .accessibilityLabel(title)
    }
}
```

### 2.2a Enhance MVVM with Access Control & Best Practices âœ… COMPLETED

**Goal:** Refine existing ViewModels to follow Hacking with Swift best practices for better encapsulation and API design.

**Based on:** [Hacking with Swift - Introducing MVVM](https://www.hackingwithswift.com/books/ios-swiftui/introducing-mvvm-into-your-swiftui-project)

**Current State:**
- âœ… ViewModels created and integrated (FeedViewModel, SearchViewModel)
- âŒ Properties are publicly mutable (not encapsulated)
- âŒ No clear API surface for state mutations
- âŒ Missing automatic persistence patterns

**Key Improvements from HWS:**

1. **Access Control with `private(set)`**
   - Make state properties read-only from outside
   - Force mutations through methods for better control
   - Clearer API surface for consumers

2. **Controlled Mutations**
   - All state changes go through methods
   - Easier to add side effects (analytics, logging, persistence)
   - Better testability

3. **Practical MVVM**
   - "There is no single definition of MVVM" - be flexible
   - Don't move everything - simple state can stay in views
   - Focus on testability as the main benefit

**Implementation:**

**Before (Current Pattern):**
```swift
@Observable
class FeedViewModel {
    var posts: [FeedPost] = []  // Publicly mutable âŒ
    var isLoading = false
    var selectedFilter: FeedFilter = .all

    func loadFeed() async {
        isLoading = true  // Direct mutation
        // ...
    }
}

// Usage in View:
viewModel.posts.append(newPost)  // Can mutate directly âŒ
```

**After (HWS Pattern with private(set)):**
```swift

class FeedViewModel {
    // MARK: - Published State (read-only from outside)
    private(set) var posts: [FeedPost] = []  âœ…
    private(set) var isLoading = false
    private(set) var error: Error?

    // MARK: - User-controlled State (can be modified by view)
    var selectedFilter: FeedFilter = .all
    var showCreatePost = false

    // MARK: - Computed Properties
    var filteredPosts: [FeedPost] {
        switch selectedFilter {
        case .all: return posts
        case .squad(let name): return posts.filter { $0.squad == name }
        // ... other filters
        }
    }

    // MARK: - Actions (controlled mutations)
    func loadFeed() async {
        isLoading = true  âœ… Only ViewModel can set this
        error = nil

        do {
            let fetchedPosts = try await fetchPosts()
            posts = fetchedPosts  âœ… Controlled mutation
            isLoading = false
        } catch {
            self.error = error
            isLoading = false
        }
    }

    func selectSquad(_ squad: String?) {
        selectedFilter = squad.map { .squad($0) } ?? .all
        Task { await loadFeed() }
    }

    func toggleCreatePost() {
        showCreatePost.toggle()
    }

    func addPost(_ post: FeedPost) {
        posts.insert(post, at: 0)  âœ… Controlled mutation
        saveToCache()  // Easy to add side effects
    }

    // MARK: - Private Helpers
    private func fetchPosts() async throws -> [FeedPost] {
        // API call
        []
    }

    private func saveToCache() {
        // Automatic persistence (HWS pattern)
    }
}

// Usage in View:
// viewModel.posts.append(newPost)  âŒ Compile error!
viewModel.addPost(newPost)  âœ… Must use method
```

**Benefits:**

1. **Encapsulation**
   - State can only be modified through well-defined methods
   - Prevents accidental mutations from views
   - Clear contract between View and ViewModel

2. **Testability**

   ```swift
       let vm = FeedViewModel()
       await vm.loadFeed()

       XCTAssertFalse(vm.isLoading)  // Can read state
       XCTAssertFalse(vm.posts.isEmpty)
   ```

3. **Side Effects**
   - Easy to add analytics, logging, caching
   - All mutations go through methods
   - Example: Auto-save on every change (HWS pattern)

   ```swift
   viewModel.loadFeed()           âœ… Action
   viewModel.selectSquad("Carroll") âœ… Action
   viewModel.filteredPosts         âœ… Read data
   // viewModel.posts = []          âŒ Not possible
   ```

```swift
import SwiftUI
```

```swift
struct CircleFilter: View {
    let name: String
    let icon: String?
    let imageName: String?
    let iconColor: Color
    let isSelected: Bool
    let action: () -> Void

    init(
        name: String,
        icon: String? = nil,
        imageName: String? = nil,
        iconColor: Color = .blue,
        isSelected: Bool = false,
        action: @escaping () -> Void
    ) {
        self.name = name
        self.icon = icon
        self.imageName = imageName
        self.iconColor = iconColor
        self.isSelected = isSelected
        self.action = action
    }

    var body: some View {
        Button(action: action) {
            VStack(spacing: .spacing2) {
                // Circle with content
                ZStack {
                    // Outer ring
                    Circle()
                        .strokeBorder(
                            LinearGradient(
                                colors: isSelected
                                    ? [iconColor, iconColor.opacity(0.6)]
                                    : [Color.white.opacity(0.3), Color.white.opacity(0.3)],
                                startPoint: .topLeading,
                                endPoint: .bottomTrailing
                            ),
                            lineWidth: 3
                        )
                        .frame(width: 70, height: 70)

                    // Inner circle
                    Circle()
                        .fill(
                            LinearGradient(
                                colors: isSelected
                                    ? [iconColor.opacity(0.3), iconColor.opacity(0.2)]
                                    : [Color.white.opacity(0.2), Color.white.opacity(0.1)],
                                startPoint: .topLeading,
                                endPoint: .bottomTrailing
                            )
                        )
                        .frame(width: 64, height: 64)

                    // Content (image or icon)
                    if let imageName = imageName {
                        Image(imageName)
                            .resizable()
                            .scaledToFill()
                            .frame(width: 64, height: 64)
                            .clipShape(Circle())
                    } else if let icon = icon {
                        Image(systemName: icon)
                            .font(.system(size: 28))
                            .foregroundColor(isSelected ? iconColor : .gray)
                    }
                }

                // Name label
                Text(name)
                    .font(.caption)
                    .fontWeight(isSelected ? .semibold : .regular)
                    .foregroundColor(isSelected ? .white : .gray)
                    .lineLimit(1)
            }
            .frame(width: 80)
        }
        .accessibilityLabel("\(name) filter")
        .accessibilityAddTraits(isSelected ? .isSelected : [])
        .accessibilityHint(isSelected ? "Currently selected" : "Double tap to select")
    }
}
```
