import SwiftUI

struct MenuItem<Destination: View>: View {
    let icon: String
    let title: String
    let iconColor: Color
    let destination: Destination?
    let action: (() -> Void)?

    init(
        icon: String,
        title: String,
        iconColor: Color = .brandPrimary,
        destination: Destination
    ) where Destination: View {
        self.icon = icon
        self.title = title
        self.iconColor = iconColor
        self.destination = destination
        self.action = nil
    }

    init(
        icon: String,
        title: String,
        iconColor: Color = .brandPrimary,
        action: @escaping () -> Void
    ) where Destination == EmptyView {
        self.icon = icon
        self.title = title
        self.iconColor = iconColor
        self.destination = nil
        self.action = action
    }

    var body: some View {
        Group {
            if let destination = destination {
                NavigationLink(destination: destination) {
                    content
                }
            } else {
                Button(action: action ?? {}) {
                    content
                }
            }
        }
        .accessibilityElement(combining: .children)
        .accessibilityLabel(title)
        .accessibilityHint("Navigate to \(title)")
    }

    private var content: some View {
        HStack(spacing: .spacing4) {
            Image(systemName: icon)
                .foregroundColor(.white)
                .frame(width: 36, height: 36)
                .background(iconColor)
                .clipShape(Circle())
                .accessibilityHidden(true)

            Text(title)
                .font(.cardTitle)
                .foregroundColor(.primary)

            Spacer()

            Image(systemName: "chevron.right")
                .foregroundColor(.secondary)
                .font(.caption)
                .accessibilityHidden(true)
        }
        .padding(.spacing4)
    }
}

import SwiftUI

enum UserType: String, Codable {
    case athlete = "Athlete"
    case clubCoach = "Club Coach"
    case collegeCoach = "College Coach"
    case parent = "Parent"

    var accentColor: Color {
        switch self {
        case .athlete:
            return .blue
        case .clubCoach:
            return .orange
        case .collegeCoach:
            return .red
        case .parent:
            return .green
        }
    }

    var gradientColors: [Color] {
        switch self {
        case .athlete:
            return [.blue, .purple]
        case .clubCoach:
            return [.orange, Color(red: 1.0, green: 0.4, blue: 0.0)]
        case .collegeCoach:
            return [.red, Color(red: 1.0, green: 0.2, blue: 0.4)]
        case .parent:
            return [.green, .teal]
        }
    }

    var gradient: LinearGradient {
        LinearGradient(
            colors: gradientColors,
            startPoint: .topLeading,
            endPoint: .bottomTrailing
        )
    }
}

// Environment key
struct UserTypeKey: EnvironmentKey {
    static let defaultValue: UserType = .athlete
}

extension EnvironmentValues {
    var userType: UserType {
        get { self[UserTypeKey.self] }
        set { self[UserTypeKey.self] = newValue }
    }
}

struct ButtonPressModifier: ViewModifier {
    @State private var isPressed = false
    @Environment(\.accessibilityReduceMotion) var reduceMotion

    func body(content: Content) -> some View {
        content
            .scaleEffect(isPressed && !reduceMotion ? 0.95 : 1.0)
            .opacity(isPressed ? 0.8 : 1.0)
            .gesture(
                DragGesture(minimumDistance: 0)
                    .onChanged { _ in
                        if !isPressed {
                            isPressed = true
                            UIImpactFeedbackGenerator(style: .medium).impactOccurred()
                        }
                    }
                    .onEnded { _ in
                        isPressed = false
                    }
            )
    }
}

extension View {
    func buttonPressEffect() -> some View {
        modifier(ButtonPressModifier())
    }
}

import SwiftUI

/// A glass-morphism card with blur effect and border
/// Uses DesignTheme colors for consistent styling
struct GlassCard<Content: View>: View {
    let content: Content
    var cornerRadius: CGFloat = .radiusLarge
    var padding: CGFloat = .spacing4

    @Environment(\.designTheme) private var theme
    @Environment(\.colorScheme) private var colorScheme

    init(
        cornerRadius: CGFloat = .radiusLarge,
        padding: CGFloat = .spacing4,
        @ViewBuilder content: () -> Content
    ) {
        self.cornerRadius = cornerRadius
        self.padding = padding
        self.content = content()
    }

    var body: some View {
        content
            .padding(padding)
            .background(
                RoundedRectangle(cornerRadius: cornerRadius, style: .continuous)
                    .fill(theme.color(.card))
                    .overlay(
                        RoundedRectangle(cornerRadius: cornerRadius, style: .continuous)
                            .stroke(theme.color(.border).opacity(0.3), lineWidth: 1)
                    )
            )
    }
}

// ViewModifier version
struct GlassCardModifier: ViewModifier {
    var cornerRadius: CGFloat = .radiusLarge

    @Environment(\.designTheme) private var theme

    func body(content: Content) -> some View {
        content
            .background(
                RoundedRectangle(cornerRadius: cornerRadius, style: .continuous)
                    .fill(theme.color(.card))
                    .overlay(
                        RoundedRectangle(cornerRadius: cornerRadius, style: .continuous)
                            .stroke(theme.color(.border).opacity(0.3), lineWidth: 1)
                    )
            )
    }
}

extension View {
    func glassCard(cornerRadius: CGFloat = .radiusLarge) -> some View {
        modifier(GlassCardModifier(cornerRadius: cornerRadius))
    }
}

extension DSButton {
    /// Enhanced button with icon and loading state support

        action: @escaping () -> Void
    ) {

        self.intent = intent
        self.size = size
        self.isLoading = isLoading
        self.icon = icon
        self.action = {
            // Add haptic feedback
            UIImpactFeedbackGenerator(style: .medium).impactOccurred()
            action()
        }

// MARK: - App-Specific Button Wrapper
struct BrandButton: View {
    let title: String
    let icon: String?
    let style: ButtonStyle
    let isLoading: Bool
    let action: () -> Void

    enum ButtonStyle {
        case primary
        case secondary
        case destructive
        case outline

        var dsIntent: DSButton.Intent {
            switch self {
            case .primary: return .primary
            case .secondary: return .secondary
            case .destructive: return .destructive
            case .outline: return .secondary // Will customize
            }
        }
    }

    @Environment(\.isEnabled) private var isEnabled
    @Environment(\.designTheme) private var theme

    init(
        title: String,
        icon: String? = nil,
        style: ButtonStyle = .primary,
        isLoading: Bool = false,
        action: @escaping () -> Void
    ) {
        self.title = title
        self.icon = icon
        self.style = style
        self.isLoading = isLoading
        self.action = action
    }

    var body: some View {
        if style == .outline {
            // Custom outline style
            outlineButton
        } else {
            // Use DSButton for standard styles
            DSButton(
                title,
                icon: icon,
                intent: style.dsIntent,
                isLoading: isLoading,
                action: action
            )
        }
    }

    private var outlineButton: some View {
        Button(action: {
            UIImpactFeedbackGenerator(style: .medium).impactOccurred()
            action()
        }) {
            HStack(spacing: .spacing3) {
                if isLoading {
                    ProgressView()
                        .tint(theme.color(.primary))
                } else {
                    if let icon = icon {
                        Image(systemName: icon)
                    }
                    Text(title)
                        .font(theme.font(.body))
                }
            }
            .frame(maxWidth: .infinity)
            .padding()
            .foregroundStyle(theme.color(.primary))
            .background(
                RoundedRectangle(cornerRadius: .radiusLarge, style: .continuous)
                    .stroke(theme.color(.primary), lineWidth: 2)
            )
        }
        .disabled(!isEnabled || isLoading)
        .opacity(isEnabled ? 1.0 : 0.5)
        .accessibilityLabel(title)
    }
}

### 2.2a Enhance MVVM with Access Control & Best Practices âœ… COMPLETED

**Goal:** Refine existing ViewModels to follow Hacking with Swift best practices for better encapsulation and API design.

**Based on:** [Hacking with Swift - Introducing MVVM](https://www.hackingwithswift.com/books/ios-swiftui/introducing-mvvm-into-your-swiftui-project)

**Current State:**
- âœ… ViewModels created and integrated (FeedViewModel, SearchViewModel)
- âŒ Properties are publicly mutable (not encapsulated)
- âŒ No clear API surface for state mutations
- âŒ Missing automatic persistence patterns

**Key Improvements from HWS:**

1. **Access Control with `private(set)`**
   - Make state properties read-only from outside
   - Force mutations through methods for better control
   - Clearer API surface for consumers

2. **Controlled Mutations**
   - All state changes go through methods
   - Easier to add side effects (analytics, logging, persistence)
   - Better testability

3. **Practical MVVM**
   - "There is no single definition of MVVM" - be flexible
   - Don't move everything - simple state can stay in views
   - Focus on testability as the main benefit

**Implementation:**

**Before (Current Pattern):**
```swift

class FeedViewModel {
    var posts: [FeedPost] = []  // Publicly mutable âŒ
    var isLoading = false
    var selectedFilter: FeedFilter = .all

    func loadFeed() async {
        isLoading = true  // Direct mutation
        // ...
    }
}

// Usage in View:
viewModel.posts.append(newPost)  // Can mutate directly âŒ
```

**After (HWS Pattern with private(set)):**
```swift

class FeedViewModel {
    // MARK: - Published State (read-only from outside)
    private(set) var posts: [FeedPost] = []  âœ…
    private(set) var isLoading = false
    private(set) var error: Error?

    // MARK: - User-controlled State (can be modified by view)
    var selectedFilter: FeedFilter = .all
    var showCreatePost = false

    // MARK: - Computed Properties
    var filteredPosts: [FeedPost] {
        switch selectedFilter {
        case .all: return posts
        case .squad(let name): return posts.filter { $0.squad == name }
        // ... other filters
        }
    }

    // MARK: - Actions (controlled mutations)
    func loadFeed() async {
        isLoading = true  âœ… Only ViewModel can set this
        error = nil

        do {
            let fetchedPosts = try await fetchPosts()
            posts = fetchedPosts  âœ… Controlled mutation
            isLoading = false
        } catch {
            self.error = error
            isLoading = false
        }
    }

    func selectSquad(_ squad: String?) {
        selectedFilter = squad.map { .squad($0) } ?? .all
        Task { await loadFeed() }
    }

    func toggleCreatePost() {
        showCreatePost.toggle()
    }

    func addPost(_ post: FeedPost) {
        posts.insert(post, at: 0)  âœ… Controlled mutation
        saveToCache()  // Easy to add side effects
    }

    // MARK: - Private Helpers
    private func fetchPosts() async throws -> [FeedPost] {
        // API call
        []
    }

    private func saveToCache() {
        // Automatic persistence (HWS pattern)
    }
}

// Usage in View:
// viewModel.posts.append(newPost)  âŒ Compile error!
viewModel.addPost(newPost)  âœ… Must use method
```

**Benefits:**

1. **Encapsulation**
   - State can only be modified through well-defined methods
   - Prevents accidental mutations from views
   - Clear contract between View and ViewModel

2. **Testability**
   ```swift

       let vm = FeedViewModel()
       await vm.loadFeed()

       XCTAssertFalse(vm.isLoading)  // Can read state
       XCTAssertFalse(vm.posts.isEmpty)
       // vm.isLoading = true  âŒ Can't mutate directly

   ```

3. **Side Effects**
   - Easy to add analytics, logging, caching
   - All mutations go through methods
   - Example: Auto-save on every change (HWS pattern)

4. **API Clarity**
   ```swift

   viewModel.loadFeed()           âœ… Action
   viewModel.selectSquad("Carroll") âœ… Action
   viewModel.filteredPosts         âœ… Read data
   // viewModel.posts = []          âŒ Not possible
   ```

import SwiftUI

struct CircleFilter: View {
    let name: String
    let icon: String?
    let imageName: String?
    let iconColor: Color
    let isSelected: Bool
    let action: () -> Void

    init(
        name: String,
        icon: String? = nil,
        imageName: String? = nil,
        iconColor: Color = .blue,
        isSelected: Bool = false,
        action: @escaping () -> Void
    ) {
        self.name = name
        self.icon = icon
        self.imageName = imageName
        self.iconColor = iconColor
        self.isSelected = isSelected
        self.action = action
    }

    var body: some View {
        Button(action: action) {
            VStack(spacing: .spacing2) {
                // Circle with content
                ZStack {
                    // Outer ring
                    Circle()
                        .strokeBorder(
                            LinearGradient(
                                colors: isSelected
                                    ? [iconColor, iconColor.opacity(0.6)]
                                    : [Color.white.opacity(0.3), Color.white.opacity(0.3)],
                                startPoint: .topLeading,
                                endPoint: .bottomTrailing
                            ),
                            lineWidth: 3
                        )
                        .frame(width: 70, height: 70)

                    // Inner circle
                    Circle()
                        .fill(
                            LinearGradient(
                                colors: isSelected
                                    ? [iconColor.opacity(0.3), iconColor.opacity(0.2)]
                                    : [Color.white.opacity(0.2), Color.white.opacity(0.1)],
                                startPoint: .topLeading,
                                endPoint: .bottomTrailing
                            )
                        )
                        .frame(width: 64, height: 64)

                    // Content (image or icon)
                    if let imageName = imageName {
                        Image(imageName)
                            .resizable()
                            .scaledToFill()
                            .frame(width: 64, height: 64)
                            .clipShape(Circle())
                    } else if let icon = icon {
                        Image(systemName: icon)
                            .font(.system(size: 28))
                            .foregroundColor(isSelected ? iconColor : .gray)
                    }
                }

                // Name label
                Text(name)
                    .font(.caption)
                    .fontWeight(isSelected ? .semibold : .regular)
                    .foregroundColor(isSelected ? .white : .gray)
                    .lineLimit(1)
            }
            .frame(width: 80)
        }
        .accessibilityLabel("\(name) filter")
        .accessibilityAddTraits(isSelected ? .isSelected : [])
        .accessibilityHint(isSelected ? "Currently selected" : "Double tap to select")
    }
}

import SwiftUI

struct MenuItem<Destination: View>: View {
    let icon: String
    let title: String
    let iconColor: Color
    let destination: Destination?
    let action: (() -> Void)?

    init(
        icon: String,
        title: String,
        iconColor: Color = .brandPrimary,
        destination: Destination
    ) where Destination: View {
        self.icon = icon
        self.title = title
        self.iconColor = iconColor
        self.destination = destination
        self.action = nil
    }

    init(
        icon: String,
        title: String,
        iconColor: Color = .brandPrimary,
        action: @escaping () -> Void
    ) where Destination == EmptyView {
        self.icon = icon
        self.title = title
        self.iconColor = iconColor
        self.destination = nil
        self.action = action
    }

    var body: some View {
        Group {
            if let destination = destination {
                NavigationLink(destination: destination) {
                    content
                }
            } else {
                Button(action: action ?? {}) {
                    content
                }
            }
        }
        .accessibilityElement(combining: .children)
        .accessibilityLabel(title)
        .accessibilityHint("Navigate to \(title)")
    }

    private var content: some View {
        HStack(spacing: .spacing4) {
            Image(systemName: icon)
                .foregroundColor(.white)
                .frame(width: 36, height: 36)
                .background(iconColor)
                .clipShape(Circle())
                .accessibilityHidden(true)

            Text(title)
                .font(.cardTitle)
                .foregroundColor(.primary)

            Spacer()

            Image(systemName: "chevron.right")
                .foregroundColor(.secondary)
                .font(.caption)
                .accessibilityHidden(true)
        }
        .padding(.spacing4)
    }
}

import SwiftUI

enum UserType: String, Codable {
    case athlete = "Athlete"
    case clubCoach = "Club Coach"
    case collegeCoach = "College Coach"
    case parent = "Parent"

    var accentColor: Color {
        switch self {
        case .athlete:
            return .blue
        case .clubCoach:
            return .orange
        case .collegeCoach:
            return .red
        case .parent:
            return .green
        }
    }

    var gradientColors: [Color] {
        switch self {
        case .athlete:
            return [.blue, .purple]
        case .clubCoach:
            return [.orange, Color(red: 1.0, green: 0.4, blue: 0.0)]
        case .collegeCoach:
            return [.red, Color(red: 1.0, green: 0.2, blue: 0.4)]
        case .parent:
            return [.green, .teal]
        }
    }

    var gradient: LinearGradient {
        LinearGradient(
            colors: gradientColors,
            startPoint: .topLeading,
            endPoint: .bottomTrailing
        )
    }
}

// Environment key
struct UserTypeKey: EnvironmentKey {
    static let defaultValue: UserType = .athlete
}

extension EnvironmentValues {
    var userType: UserType {
        get { self[UserTypeKey.self] }
        set { self[UserTypeKey.self] = newValue }
    }
}

import SwiftUI

struct StatItem {
    let value: String
    let label: String
    let icon: String?
}

struct StatsBar: View {
    let stats: [StatItem]
    var style: StatsStyle = .horizontal

    enum StatsStyle {
        case horizontal
        case vertical
    }

    var body: some View {
        Group {
            switch style {
            case .horizontal:
                horizontalLayout
            case .vertical:
                verticalLayout
            }
        }
    }

    private var horizontalLayout: some View {
        HStack(spacing: 0) {
            ForEach(Array(stats.enumerated()), id: \.offset) { index, stat in
                StatItemView(stat: stat)
                    .frame(maxWidth: .infinity)

                if index < stats.count - 1 {
                    Divider()
                }
            }
        }
        .glassCard()
    }

    private var verticalLayout: some View {
        VStack(spacing: .spacing3) {
            ForEach(Array(stats.enumerated()), id: \.offset) { index, stat in
                StatItemView(stat: stat, isVertical: true)

                if index < stats.count - 1 {
                    Divider()
                }
            }
        }
        .glassCard()
    }
}

struct StatItemView: View {
    let stat: StatItem
    var isVertical: Bool = false

    var body: some View {
        VStack(spacing: .spacing2) {
            if let icon = stat.icon {
                Image(systemName: icon)
                    .font(.caption)
                    .foregroundColor(.brandPrimary)
                    .accessibilityHidden(true)
            }

            Text(stat.value)
                .font(.title3)
                .fontWeight(.bold)
                .foregroundColor(.primary)

            Text(stat.label)
                .font(.caption)
                .foregroundColor(.secondary)
        }
        .padding(.spacing3)
        .frame(maxWidth: isVertical ? .infinity : nil, alignment: isVertical ? .leading : .center)
        .accessibilityElement(combining: .children)
        .accessibilityLabel("\(stat.value) \(stat.label)")
    }
}

struct ButtonPressModifier: ViewModifier {
    @State private var isPressed = false
    @Environment(\.accessibilityReduceMotion) var reduceMotion

    func body(content: Content) -> some View {
        content
            .scaleEffect(isPressed && !reduceMotion ? 0.95 : 1.0)
            .opacity(isPressed ? 0.8 : 1.0)
            .gesture(
                DragGesture(minimumDistance: 0)
                    .onChanged { _ in
                        if !isPressed {
                            isPressed = true
                            UIImpactFeedbackGenerator(style: .medium).impactOccurred()
                        }
                    }
                    .onEnded { _ in
                        isPressed = false
                    }
            )
    }
}

extension View {
    func buttonPressEffect() -> some View {
        modifier(ButtonPressModifier())
    }
}
```

## Risk Management

### Identified Risks

1. **Scope Creep**
   - *Risk:* Adding features instead of focusing on design system
   - *Mitigation:* Strict adherence to plan, no new features
   - *Impact:* High
   - *Likelihood:* Medium

2. **Breaking Changes**
   - *Risk:* Refactoring breaks existing functionality
   - *Mitigation:* Incremental changes, thorough testing
   - *Impact:* High
   - *Likelihood:* Medium

3. **Time Constraints**
   - *Risk:* Tasks take longer than estimated
   - *Mitigation:* Buffer week built in, prioritize critical items
   - *Impact:* Medium
   - *Likelihood:* High

4. **Accessibility Complexity**
   - *Risk:* Accessibility testing reveals more work than expected
   - *Mitigation:* Start early, dedicate full week
   - *Impact:* Medium
   - *Likelihood:* Medium

5. **Device Coverage**
   - *Risk:* Not enough devices for thorough testing
   - *Mitigation:* Use simulator + TestFlight beta
   - *Impact:* Low
   - *Likelihood:* Low

- Defer nice-to-have components to Phase 6
- Maintain accessibility as non-negotiable

**If breaking changes occur:**

- Implement changes in smaller increments
- Add unit tests before proceeding

import SwiftUI

/// A glass-morphism card with blur effect and border
/// Uses DesignTheme colors for consistent styling
struct GlassCard<Content: View>: View {
    let content: Content
    var cornerRadius: CGFloat = .radiusLarge
    var padding: CGFloat = .spacing4

    @Environment(\.designTheme) private var theme
    @Environment(\.colorScheme) private var colorScheme

    init(
        cornerRadius: CGFloat = .radiusLarge,
        padding: CGFloat = .spacing4,
        @ViewBuilder content: () -> Content
    ) {
        self.cornerRadius = cornerRadius
        self.padding = padding
        self.content = content()
    }

    var body: some View {
        content
            .padding(padding)
            .background(
                RoundedRectangle(cornerRadius: cornerRadius, style: .continuous)
                    .fill(theme.color(.card))
                    .overlay(
                        RoundedRectangle(cornerRadius: cornerRadius, style: .continuous)
                            .stroke(theme.color(.border).opacity(0.3), lineWidth: 1)
                    )
            )
    }
}

// ViewModifier version
struct GlassCardModifier: ViewModifier {
    var cornerRadius: CGFloat = .radiusLarge

    @Environment(\.designTheme) private var theme

    func body(content: Content) -> some View {
        content
            .background(
                RoundedRectangle(cornerRadius: cornerRadius, style: .continuous)
                    .fill(theme.color(.card))
                    .overlay(
                        RoundedRectangle(cornerRadius: cornerRadius, style: .continuous)
                            .stroke(theme.color(.border).opacity(0.3), lineWidth: 1)
                    )
            )
    }
}

extension View {
    func glassCard(cornerRadius: CGFloat = .radiusLarge) -> some View {
        modifier(GlassCardModifier(cornerRadius: cornerRadius))
    }
}
```

import SwiftUI

// MARK: - Enhanced DSButton with Icons & Loading
extension DSButton {
    /// Enhanced button with icon and loading state support
    init(
        _ title: String,
        icon: String? = nil,
        intent: Intent = .primary,
        size: Size = .m,
        isLoading: Bool = false,
        action: @escaping () -> Void
    ) {
        self.title = title
        self.intent = intent
        self.size = size
        self.isLoading = isLoading
        self.icon = icon
        self.action = {
            // Add haptic feedback
            UIImpactFeedbackGenerator(style: .medium).impactOccurred()
            action()
        }
    }
}

// MARK: - App-Specific Button Wrapper
struct BrandButton: View {
    let title: String
    let icon: String?
    let style: ButtonStyle
    let isLoading: Bool
    let action: () -> Void

    enum ButtonStyle {
        case primary
        case secondary
        case destructive
        case outline

        var dsIntent: DSButton.Intent {
            switch self {
            case .primary: return .primary
            case .secondary: return .secondary
            case .destructive: return .destructive
            case .outline: return .secondary // Will customize
            }
        }
    }

    @Environment(\.isEnabled) private var isEnabled
    @Environment(\.designTheme) private var theme

    init(
        title: String,
        icon: String? = nil,
        style: ButtonStyle = .primary,
        isLoading: Bool = false,
        action: @escaping () -> Void
    ) {
        self.title = title
        self.icon = icon
        self.style = style
        self.isLoading = isLoading
        self.action = action
    }

    var body: some View {
        if style == .outline {
            // Custom outline style
            outlineButton
        } else {
            // Use DSButton for standard styles
            DSButton(
                title,
                icon: icon,
                intent: style.dsIntent,
                isLoading: isLoading,
                action: action
            )
        }
    }

    private var outlineButton: some View {
        Button(action: {
            UIImpactFeedbackGenerator(style: .medium).impactOccurred()
            action()
        }) {
            HStack(spacing: .spacing3) {
                if isLoading {
                    ProgressView()
                        .tint(theme.color(.primary))
                } else {
                    if let icon = icon {
                        Image(systemName: icon)
                    }
                    Text(title)
                        .font(theme.font(.body))
                }
            }
            .frame(maxWidth: .infinity)
            .padding()
            .foregroundStyle(theme.color(.primary))
            .background(
                RoundedRectangle(cornerRadius: .radiusLarge, style: .continuous)
                    .stroke(theme.color(.primary), lineWidth: 2)
            )
        }
        .disabled(!isEnabled || isLoading)
        .opacity(isEnabled ? 1.0 : 0.5)

   - *Risk:* Adding features instead of focusing on design system
   - *Mitigation:* Strict adherence to plan, no new features
   - *Impact:* High
   - *Likelihood:* Medium

2. **Breaking Changes**
   - *Risk:* Refactoring breaks existing functionality
   - *Mitigation:* Incremental changes, thorough testing
   - *Impact:* High
   - *Likelihood:* Medium

3. **Time Constraints**
   - *Risk:* Tasks take longer than estimated
   - *Mitigation:* Buffer week built in, prioritize critical items
   - *Impact:* Medium
   - *Likelihood:* High

4. **Accessibility Complexity**
   - *Risk:* Accessibility testing reveals more work than expected
   - *Mitigation:* Start early, dedicate full week
   - *Impact:* Medium
   - *Likelihood:* Medium

5. **Device Coverage**
   - *Risk:* Not enough devices for thorough testing
   - *Mitigation:* Use simulator + TestFlight beta
   - *Impact:* Low
   - *Likelihood:* Low

### Contingency Plans

**If behind schedule after Week 2:**
- Focus on critical components only (GlassCard, BrandButton, FeedPost)
- Defer nice-to-have components to Phase 6
- Maintain accessibility as non-negotiable

**If breaking changes occur:**
- Revert to last working state
- Implement changes in smaller increments
- Add unit tests before proceeding

**If accessibility goals unreachable:**
- Focus on VoiceOver and Dynamic Type (highest impact)
- Defer color contrast to minor iteration
- Maintain 90% coverage minimum

**Goal:** Refine existing ViewModels to follow Hacking with Swift best practices for better encapsulation and API design.

**Based on:** [Hacking with Swift - Introducing MVVM](https://www.hackingwithswift.com/books/ios-swiftui/introducing-mvvm-into-your-swiftui-project)

- âŒ Properties are publicly mutable (not encapsulated)
- âŒ No clear API surface for state mutations
- âŒ Missing automatic persistence patterns

**Key Improvements from HWS:**

1. **Access Control with `private(set)`**
   - Make state properties read-only from outside
   - Force mutations through methods for better control
   - Clearer API surface for consumers

2. **Controlled Mutations**
   - All state changes go through methods
   - Easier to add side effects (analytics, logging, persistence)
   - Better testability

3. **Practical MVVM**
   - "There is no single definition of MVVM" - be flexible
   - Don't move everything - simple state can stay in views
   - Focus on testability as the main benefit

import SwiftUI

struct MenuItem<Destination: View>: View {
    let icon: String
    let title: String
    let iconColor: Color
    let destination: Destination?
    let action: (() -> Void)?

    init(
        icon: String,
        title: String,
        iconColor: Color = .brandPrimary,
        destination: Destination
    ) where Destination: View {
        self.icon = icon
        self.title = title
        self.iconColor = iconColor
        self.destination = destination
        self.action = nil
    }

    init(
        icon: String,
        title: String,
        iconColor: Color = .brandPrimary,
        action: @escaping () -> Void
    ) where Destination == EmptyView {
        self.icon = icon
        self.title = title
        self.iconColor = iconColor
        self.destination = nil
        self.action = action
    }

    var body: some View {
        Group {
            if let destination = destination {
                NavigationLink(destination: destination) {
                    content
                }
            } else {
                Button(action: action ?? {}) {
                    content
                }
            }
        }
        .accessibilityElement(combining: .children)
        .accessibilityLabel(title)
        .accessibilityHint("Navigate to \(title)")
    }

            Spacer()

            Image(systemName: "chevron.right")

import SwiftUI

enum UserType: String, Codable {
    case athlete = "Athlete"
    case clubCoach = "Club Coach"
    case collegeCoach = "College Coach"
    case parent = "Parent"

    var accentColor: Color {
        switch self {
        case .athlete:
            return .blue
        case .clubCoach:
            return .orange
        case .collegeCoach:
            return .red
        case .parent:
            return .green
        }
    }

    var gradientColors: [Color] {
        switch self {
        case .athlete:
            return [.blue, .purple]
        case .clubCoach:
            return [.orange, Color(red: 1.0, green: 0.4, blue: 0.0)]
        case .collegeCoach:
            return [.red, Color(red: 1.0, green: 0.2, blue: 0.4)]
        case .parent:
            return [.green, .teal]
        }
    }

    var gradient: LinearGradient {
        LinearGradient(
            colors: gradientColors,
            startPoint: .topLeading,
            endPoint: .bottomTrailing
        )
    }
}

// Environment key
struct UserTypeKey: EnvironmentKey {
    static let defaultValue: UserType = .athlete
}

extension EnvironmentValues {
    var userType: UserType {
        get { self[UserTypeKey.self] }
        set { self[UserTypeKey.self] = newValue }
    }
}

**Implementation:**
```swift
import SwiftUI

struct StatItem {
    let value: String
    let label: String
    let icon: String?
}

struct StatsBar: View {
    let stats: [StatItem]
    var style: StatsStyle = .horizontal

    enum StatsStyle {
        case horizontal
        case vertical
    }

    var body: some View {
        Group {
            switch style {
            case .horizontal:
                horizontalLayout
            case .vertical:
                verticalLayout
            }
        }
    }

    private var horizontalLayout: some View {
        HStack(spacing: 0) {
            ForEach(Array(stats.enumerated()), id: \.offset) { index, stat in
                StatItemView(stat: stat)
                    .frame(maxWidth: .infinity)

                if index < stats.count - 1 {
                    Divider()
                }
            }
        }
        .glassCard()
    }

    private var verticalLayout: some View {
        VStack(spacing: .spacing3) {
            ForEach(Array(stats.enumerated()), id: \.offset) { index, stat in
                StatItemView(stat: stat, isVertical: true)

                if index < stats.count - 1 {
                    Divider()
                }
            }
        }
        .glassCard()
    }
}

struct StatItemView: View {
    let stat: StatItem
    var isVertical: Bool = false

    var body: some View {
        VStack(spacing: .spacing2) {
            if let icon = stat.icon {
                Image(systemName: icon)
                    .font(.caption)
                    .foregroundColor(.brandPrimary)
                    .accessibilityHidden(true)
            }

            Text(stat.value)
                .font(.title3)
                .fontWeight(.bold)
                .foregroundColor(.primary)

            Text(stat.label)
                .font(.caption)
                .foregroundColor(.secondary)
        }
        .padding(.spacing3)
        .frame(maxWidth: isVertical ? .infinity : nil, alignment: isVertical ? .leading : .center)
        .accessibilityElement(combining: .children)
        .accessibilityLabel("\(stat.value) \(stat.label)")
    }
}

struct ButtonPressModifier: ViewModifier {
    @State private var isPressed = false
    @Environment(\.accessibilityReduceMotion) var reduceMotion

    func body(content: Content) -> some View {
        content
            .scaleEffect(isPressed && !reduceMotion ? 0.95 : 1.0)
            .opacity(isPressed ? 0.8 : 1.0)
            .gesture(
                DragGesture(minimumDistance: 0)
                    .onChanged { _ in
                        if !isPressed {
                            isPressed = true
                            UIImpactFeedbackGenerator(style: .medium).impactOccurred()
                        }
                    }
                    .onEnded { _ in
                        isPressed = false
                    }
            )
    }
}

extension View {
    func buttonPressEffect() -> some View {
        modifier(ButtonPressModifier())
    }
}
```

## Risk Management

### Identified Risks

1. **Scope Creep**
   - *Risk:* Adding features instead of focusing on design system
   - *Mitigation:* Strict adherence to plan, no new features
   - *Impact:* High
   - *Likelihood:* Medium

2. **Breaking Changes**
   - *Risk:* Refactoring breaks existing functionality
   - *Mitigation:* Incremental changes, thorough testing
   - *Impact:* High
   - *Likelihood:* Medium

3. **Time Constraints**
   - *Risk:* Tasks take longer than estimated
   - *Mitigation:* Buffer week built in, prioritize critical items
   - *Impact:* Medium
   - *Likelihood:* High

4. **Accessibility Complexity**
   - *Risk:* Accessibility testing reveals more work than expected
   - *Mitigation:* Start early, dedicate full week
   - *Impact:* Medium
   - *Likelihood:* Medium

5. **Device Coverage**
   - *Risk:* Not enough devices for thorough testing
   - *Mitigation:* Use simulator + TestFlight beta
   - *Impact:* Low
   - *Likelihood:* Low

### Contingency Plans

**If behind schedule after Week 2:**
- Focus on critical components only (GlassCard, BrandButton, FeedPost)
- Defer nice-to-have components to Phase 6
- Maintain accessibility as non-negotiable

**If breaking changes occur:**
- Revert to last working state
- Implement changes in smaller increments
- Add unit tests before proceeding

**If accessibility goals unreachable:**
- Focus on VoiceOver and Dynamic Type (highest impact)
- Defer color contrast to minor iteration

import SwiftUI

/// A glass-morphism card with blur effect and border
/// Uses DesignTheme colors for consistent styling
struct GlassCard<Content: View>: View {
    let content: Content
    var cornerRadius: CGFloat = .radiusLarge
    var padding: CGFloat = .spacing4

    @Environment(\.designTheme) private var theme
    @Environment(\.colorScheme) private var colorScheme

    init(
        cornerRadius: CGFloat = .radiusLarge,
        padding: CGFloat = .spacing4,
        @ViewBuilder content: () -> Content
    ) {
        self.cornerRadius = cornerRadius
        self.padding = padding
        self.content = content()
    }

    var body: some View {
        content
            .padding(padding)
            .background(
                RoundedRectangle(cornerRadius: cornerRadius, style: .continuous)
                    .fill(theme.color(.card))
                    .overlay(
                        RoundedRectangle(cornerRadius: cornerRadius, style: .continuous)
                            .stroke(theme.color(.border).opacity(0.3), lineWidth: 1)
                    )
            )
    }
}

// ViewModifier version
struct GlassCardModifier: ViewModifier {
    var cornerRadius: CGFloat = .radiusLarge

    @Environment(\.designTheme) private var theme

    func body(content: Content) -> some View {
        content
            .background(
                RoundedRectangle(cornerRadius: cornerRadius, style: .continuous)
                    .fill(theme.color(.card))
                    .overlay(
                        RoundedRectangle(cornerRadius: cornerRadius, style: .continuous)
                            .stroke(theme.color(.border).opacity(0.3), lineWidth: 1)
                    )
            )
    }
}

extension View {
    func glassCard(cornerRadius: CGFloat = .radiusLarge) -> some View {
        modifier(GlassCardModifier(cornerRadius: cornerRadius))
    }
}
```

import SwiftUI

// MARK: - Enhanced DSButton with Icons & Loading
extension DSButton {
    /// Enhanced button with icon and loading state support
    init(
        _ title: String,
        icon: String? = nil,
        intent: Intent = .primary,
        size: Size = .m,
        isLoading: Bool = false,
        action: @escaping () -> Void
    ) {
        self.title = title
        self.intent = intent
        self.size = size
        self.isLoading = isLoading
        self.icon = icon
        self.action = {
            // Add haptic feedback
            UIImpactFeedbackGenerator(style: .medium).impactOccurred()
            action()
        }
    }
}

// MARK: - App-Specific Button Wrapper
struct BrandButton: View {
    let title: String
    let icon: String?
    let style: ButtonStyle
    let isLoading: Bool
    let action: () -> Void

    enum ButtonStyle {
        case primary
        case secondary
        case destructive
        case outline

        var dsIntent: DSButton.Intent {
            switch self {
            case .primary: return .primary
            case .secondary: return .secondary
            case .destructive: return .destructive
            case .outline: return .secondary // Will customize
            }
        }
    }

    @Environment(\.isEnabled) private var isEnabled
    @Environment(\.designTheme) private var theme

    init(
        title: String,
        icon: String? = nil,
        style: ButtonStyle = .primary,
        isLoading: Bool = false,
        action: @escaping () -> Void
    ) {
        self.title = title
        self.icon = icon
        self.style = style
        self.isLoading = isLoading
        self.action = action
    }

    var body: some View {
        if style == .outline {
            // Custom outline style
            outlineButton
        } else {
            // Use DSButton for standard styles
            DSButton(
                title,
                icon: icon,
                intent: style.dsIntent,
                isLoading: isLoading,
                action: action
            )
        }
    }

    private var outlineButton: some View {
        Button(action: {
            UIImpactFeedbackGenerator(style: .medium).impactOccurred()
            action()
        }) {
            HStack(spacing: .spacing3) {
                if isLoading {
                    ProgressView()
                        .tint(theme.color(.primary))
                } else {
                    if let icon = icon {
                        Image(systemName: icon)
                    }
                    Text(title)
                        .font(theme.font(.body))
                }
            }
            .frame(maxWidth: .infinity)
            .padding()
            .foregroundStyle(theme.color(.primary))
            .background(
                RoundedRectangle(cornerRadius: .radiusLarge, style: .continuous)
                    .stroke(theme.color(.primary), lineWidth: 2)
            )
        }
        .disabled(!isEnabled || isLoading)
        .opacity(isEnabled ? 1.0 : 0.5)
        .accessibilityLabel(title)
    }
}
```

### 2.2a Enhance MVVM with Access Control & Best Practices âœ… COMPLETED

**Goal:** Refine existing ViewModels to follow Hacking with Swift best practices for better encapsulation and API design.

**Based on:** [Hacking with Swift - Introducing MVVM](https://www.hackingwithswift.com/books/ios-swiftui/introducing-mvvm-into-your-swiftui-project)

**Current State:**
- âœ… ViewModels created and integrated (FeedViewModel, SearchViewModel)
- âŒ Properties are publicly mutable (not encapsulated)
- âŒ No clear API surface for state mutations
- âŒ Missing automatic persistence patterns

**Key Improvements from HWS:**

1. **Access Control with `private(set)`**
   - Make state properties read-only from outside
   - Force mutations through methods for better control
   - Clearer API surface for consumers

2. **Controlled Mutations**
   - All state changes go through methods
   - Easier to add side effects (analytics, logging, persistence)
   - Better testability

3. **Practical MVVM**
   - "There is no single definition of MVVM" - be flexible
   - Don't move everything - simple state can stay in views
   - Focus on testability as the main benefit

**Implementation:**

**Before (Current Pattern):**
```swift
@Observable
class FeedViewModel {
    var posts: [FeedPost] = []  // Publicly mutable âŒ
    var isLoading = false
    var selectedFilter: FeedFilter = .all

    func loadFeed() async {
        isLoading = true  // Direct mutation
        // ...
    }
}

// Usage in View:
viewModel.posts.append(newPost)  // Can mutate directly âŒ
```

**After (HWS Pattern with private(set)):**
```swift
@Observable
class FeedViewModel {
    // MARK: - Published State (read-only from outside)
    private(set) var posts: [FeedPost] = []  âœ…
    private(set) var isLoading = false
    private(set) var error: Error?

    // MARK: - User-controlled State (can be modified by view)
    var selectedFilter: FeedFilter = .all
    var showCreatePost = false

    // MARK: - Computed Properties
    var filteredPosts: [FeedPost] {
        switch selectedFilter {
        case .all: return posts
        case .squad(let name): return posts.filter { $0.squad == name }
        // ... other filters
        }
    }

    // MARK: - Actions (controlled mutations)
    func loadFeed() async {
        isLoading = true  âœ… Only ViewModel can set this
        error = nil

        do {
            let fetchedPosts = try await fetchPosts()
            posts = fetchedPosts  âœ… Controlled mutation
            isLoading = false
        } catch {
            self.error = error
            isLoading = false
        }
    }

    func selectSquad(_ squad: String?) {
        selectedFilter = squad.map { .squad($0) } ?? .all
        Task { await loadFeed() }
    }

    func toggleCreatePost() {
        showCreatePost.toggle()
    }

    func addPost(_ post: FeedPost) {
        posts.insert(post, at: 0)  âœ… Controlled mutation
        saveToCache()  // Easy to add side effects
    }

    // MARK: - Private Helpers
    private func fetchPosts() async throws -> [FeedPost] {
        // API call
        []
    }

    private func saveToCache() {
        // Automatic persistence (HWS pattern)
    }
}

// Usage in View:
// viewModel.posts.append(newPost)  âŒ Compile error!
viewModel.addPost(newPost)  âœ… Must use method
```

**Benefits:**

1. **Encapsulation**
   - State can only be modified through well-defined methods
   - Prevents accidental mutations from views
   - Clear contract between View and ViewModel

2. **Testability**

       XCTAssertFalse(vm.isLoading)  // Can read state
       XCTAssertFalse(vm.posts.isEmpty)

3. **Side Effects**
   - Easy to add analytics, logging, caching
   - All mutations go through methods

   viewModel.loadFeed()           âœ… Action
   viewModel.selectSquad("Carroll") âœ… Action

import SwiftUI

struct CircleFilter: View {
    let name: String
    let icon: String?
    let imageName: String?
    let iconColor: Color
    let isSelected: Bool
    let action: () -> Void

    init(
        name: String,
        icon: String? = nil,
        imageName: String? = nil,
        iconColor: Color = .blue,
        isSelected: Bool = false,
        action: @escaping () -> Void
    ) {
        self.name = name
        self.icon = icon
        self.imageName = imageName
        self.iconColor = iconColor
        self.isSelected = isSelected
        self.action = action
    }

    var body: some View {
        Button(action: action) {
            VStack(spacing: .spacing2) {
                // Circle with content
                ZStack {
                    // Outer ring
                    Circle()
                        .strokeBorder(
                            LinearGradient(
                                colors: isSelected
                                    ? [iconColor, iconColor.opacity(0.6)]
                                    : [Color.white.opacity(0.3), Color.white.opacity(0.3)],
                                startPoint: .topLeading,
                                endPoint: .bottomTrailing
                            ),
                            lineWidth: 3
                        )
                        .frame(width: 70, height: 70)

                    // Inner circle
                    Circle()
                        .fill(
                            LinearGradient(
                                colors: isSelected
                                    ? [iconColor.opacity(0.3), iconColor.opacity(0.2)]
                                    : [Color.white.opacity(0.2), Color.white.opacity(0.1)],
                                startPoint: .topLeading,
                                endPoint: .bottomTrailing
                            )
                        )
                        .frame(width: 64, height: 64)

                    // Content (image or icon)
                    if let imageName = imageName {
                        Image(imageName)
                            .resizable()
                            .scaledToFill()
                            .frame(width: 64, height: 64)
                            .clipShape(Circle())
                    } else if let icon = icon {
                        Image(systemName: icon)
                            .font(.system(size: 28))
                            .foregroundColor(isSelected ? iconColor : .gray)
                    }
                }

                // Name label
                Text(name)
                    .font(.caption)
                    .fontWeight(isSelected ? .semibold : .regular)
                    .foregroundColor(isSelected ? .white : .gray)
                    .lineLimit(1)
            }
            .frame(width: 80)
        }
        .accessibilityLabel("\(name) filter")
        .accessibilityAddTraits(isSelected ? .isSelected : [])
        .accessibilityHint(isSelected ? "Currently selected" : "Double tap to select")
    }
}

import SwiftUI

struct MenuItem<Destination: View>: View {
    let icon: String
    let title: String
    let iconColor: Color
    let destination: Destination?
    let action: (() -> Void)?

    init(
        icon: String,
        title: String,
        iconColor: Color = .brandPrimary,
        destination: Destination
    ) where Destination: View {
        self.icon = icon
        self.title = title
        self.iconColor = iconColor
        self.destination = destination
        self.action = nil
    }

    init(
        icon: String,
        title: String,
        iconColor: Color = .brandPrimary,
        action: @escaping () -> Void
    ) where Destination == EmptyView {
        self.icon = icon
        self.title = title
        self.iconColor = iconColor
        self.destination = nil
        self.action = action
    }

    var body: some View {
        Group {
            if let destination = destination {
                NavigationLink(destination: destination) {
                    content
                }
            } else {
                Button(action: action ?? {}) {
                    content
                }
            }
        }
        .accessibilityElement(combining: .children)
        .accessibilityLabel(title)
        .accessibilityHint("Navigate to \(title)")
    }

    private var content: some View {
        HStack(spacing: .spacing4) {
            Image(systemName: icon)
                .foregroundColor(.white)
                .frame(width: 36, height: 36)
                .background(iconColor)
                .clipShape(Circle())
                .accessibilityHidden(true)

            Text(title)
                .font(.cardTitle)
                .foregroundColor(.primary)

            Spacer()

            Image(systemName: "chevron.right")
                .foregroundColor(.secondary)
                .font(.caption)
                .accessibilityHidden(true)
        }
        .padding(.spacing4)
    }
}

import SwiftUI

enum UserType: String, Codable {
    case athlete = "Athlete"
    case clubCoach = "Club Coach"
    case collegeCoach = "College Coach"
    case parent = "Parent"

    var accentColor: Color {
        switch self {
        case .athlete:
            return .blue
        case .clubCoach:
            return .orange
        case .collegeCoach:
            return .red
        case .parent:
            return .green
        }
    }

    var gradientColors: [Color] {
        switch self {
        case .athlete:
            return [.blue, .purple]
        case .clubCoach:
            return [.orange, Color(red: 1.0, green: 0.4, blue: 0.0)]
        case .collegeCoach:
            return [.red, Color(red: 1.0, green: 0.2, blue: 0.4)]
        case .parent:
            return [.green, .teal]
        }
    }

    var gradient: LinearGradient {
        LinearGradient(
            colors: gradientColors,
            startPoint: .topLeading,
            endPoint: .bottomTrailing
        )
    }
}

// Environment key
struct UserTypeKey: EnvironmentKey {
    static let defaultValue: UserType = .athlete
}

extension EnvironmentValues {
    var userType: UserType {
        get { self[UserTypeKey.self] }
        set { self[UserTypeKey.self] = newValue }
    }
}

struct ButtonPressModifier: ViewModifier {
    @State private var isPressed = false
    @Environment(\.accessibilityReduceMotion) var reduceMotion

    func body(content: Content) -> some View {
        content
            .scaleEffect(isPressed && !reduceMotion ? 0.95 : 1.0)
            .opacity(isPressed ? 0.8 : 1.0)
            .gesture(
                DragGesture(minimumDistance: 0)
                    .onChanged { _ in
                        if !isPressed {
                            isPressed = true
                            UIImpactFeedbackGenerator(style: .medium).impactOccurred()
                        }
                    }
                    .onEnded { _ in
                        isPressed = false
                    }
            )
    }
}

extension View {
    func buttonPressEffect() -> some View {
        modifier(ButtonPressModifier())
    }
}

## Risk Management

### Identified Risks

1. **Scope Creep**
   - *Risk:* Adding features instead of focusing on design system
   - *Mitigation:* Strict adherence to plan, no new features
   - *Impact:* High
   - *Likelihood:* Medium

2. **Breaking Changes**
   - *Risk:* Refactoring breaks existing functionality
   - *Mitigation:* Incremental changes, thorough testing
   - *Impact:* High
   - *Likelihood:* Medium

3. **Time Constraints**
   - *Risk:* Tasks take longer than estimated
   - *Mitigation:* Buffer week built in, prioritize critical items
   - *Impact:* Medium
   - *Likelihood:* High

4. **Accessibility Complexity**
   - *Risk:* Accessibility testing reveals more work than expected
   - *Mitigation:* Start early, dedicate full week
   - *Impact:* Medium
   - *Likelihood:* Medium

5. **Device Coverage**
   - *Risk:* Not enough devices for thorough testing
   - *Mitigation:* Use simulator + TestFlight beta
   - *Impact:* Low
   - *Likelihood:* Low

### Contingency Plans

**If behind schedule after Week 2:**
- Focus on critical components only (GlassCard, BrandButton, FeedPost)
- Defer nice-to-have components to Phase 6
- Maintain accessibility as non-negotiable

**If breaking changes occur:**
- Revert to last working state
- Implement changes in smaller increments
- Add unit tests before proceeding

import SwiftUI

/// A glass-morphism card with blur effect and border
/// Uses DesignTheme colors for consistent styling
struct GlassCard<Content: View>: View {
    let content: Content
    var cornerRadius: CGFloat = .radiusLarge
    var padding: CGFloat = .spacing4

    @Environment(\.designTheme) private var theme
    @Environment(\.colorScheme) private var colorScheme

    init(
        cornerRadius: CGFloat = .radiusLarge,
        padding: CGFloat = .spacing4,
        @ViewBuilder content: () -> Content
    ) {
        self.cornerRadius = cornerRadius
        self.padding = padding
        self.content = content()
    }

    var body: some View {
        content
            .padding(padding)
            .background(
                RoundedRectangle(cornerRadius: cornerRadius, style: .continuous)
                    .fill(theme.color(.card))
                    .overlay(
                        RoundedRectangle(cornerRadius: cornerRadius, style: .continuous)
                            .stroke(theme.color(.border).opacity(0.3), lineWidth: 1)
                    )
            )
    }
}

// ViewModifier version
struct GlassCardModifier: ViewModifier {
    var cornerRadius: CGFloat = .radiusLarge

    @Environment(\.designTheme) private var theme

    func body(content: Content) -> some View {
        content
            .background(
                RoundedRectangle(cornerRadius: cornerRadius, style: .continuous)
                    .fill(theme.color(.card))
                    .overlay(
                        RoundedRectangle(cornerRadius: cornerRadius, style: .continuous)
                            .stroke(theme.color(.border).opacity(0.3), lineWidth: 1)
                    )
            )
    }
}

extension View {
    func glassCard(cornerRadius: CGFloat = .radiusLarge) -> some View {
        modifier(GlassCardModifier(cornerRadius: cornerRadius))
    }
}

            case .secondary: return .secondary
            case .destructive: return .destructive

        }

### 2.2a Enhance MVVM with Access Control & Best Practices âœ… COMPLETED

**Goal:** Refine existing ViewModels to follow Hacking with Swift best practices for better encapsulation and API design.

**Based on:** [Hacking with Swift - Introducing MVVM](https://www.hackingwithswift.com/books/ios-swiftui/introducing-mvvm-into-your-swiftui-project)

**Current State:**
- âœ… ViewModels created and integrated (FeedViewModel, SearchViewModel)
- âŒ Properties are publicly mutable (not encapsulated)
- âŒ No clear API surface for state mutations
- âŒ Missing automatic persistence patterns

**Key Improvements from HWS:**

1. **Access Control with `private(set)`**
   - Make state properties read-only from outside
   - Force mutations through methods for better control
   - Clearer API surface for consumers

2. **Controlled Mutations**
   - All state changes go through methods
   - Easier to add side effects (analytics, logging, persistence)
   - Better testability

3. **Practical MVVM**
   - "There is no single definition of MVVM" - be flexible
   - Don't move everything - simple state can stay in views
   - Focus on testability as the main benefit

**Implementation:**

**Before (Current Pattern):**
```swift
@Observable
class FeedViewModel {
    var posts: [FeedPost] = []  // Publicly mutable âŒ
    var isLoading = false
    var selectedFilter: FeedFilter = .all

    func loadFeed() async {
        isLoading = true  // Direct mutation
        // ...
    }
}

// Usage in View:
viewModel.posts.append(newPost)  // Can mutate directly âŒ
```

**After (HWS Pattern with private(set)):**
```swift
@Observable
class FeedViewModel {
    // MARK: - Published State (read-only from outside)
    private(set) var posts: [FeedPost] = []  âœ…
    private(set) var isLoading = false
    private(set) var error: Error?

    // MARK: - User-controlled State (can be modified by view)
    var selectedFilter: FeedFilter = .all
    var showCreatePost = false

    // MARK: - Computed Properties
    var filteredPosts: [FeedPost] {
        switch selectedFilter {
        case .all: return posts
        case .squad(let name): return posts.filter { $0.squad == name }
        // ... other filters
        }
    }

    // MARK: - Actions (controlled mutations)
    func loadFeed() async {
        isLoading = true  âœ… Only ViewModel can set this
        error = nil

        do {
            let fetchedPosts = try await fetchPosts()
            posts = fetchedPosts  âœ… Controlled mutation
            isLoading = false
        } catch {
            self.error = error
            isLoading = false
        }
    }

    func selectSquad(_ squad: String?) {
        selectedFilter = squad.map { .squad($0) } ?? .all
        Task { await loadFeed() }
    }

    func toggleCreatePost() {
        showCreatePost.toggle()
    }

    func addPost(_ post: FeedPost) {
        posts.insert(post, at: 0)  âœ… Controlled mutation
        saveToCache()  // Easy to add side effects
    }

    // MARK: - Private Helpers
    private func fetchPosts() async throws -> [FeedPost] {
        // API call
        []
    }

    private func saveToCache() {
        // Automatic persistence (HWS pattern)
    }
}

// Usage in View:
// viewModel.posts.append(newPost)  âŒ Compile error!
viewModel.addPost(newPost)  âœ… Must use method
```

**Benefits:**

1. **Encapsulation**
   - State can only be modified through well-defined methods
   - Prevents accidental mutations from views
   - Clear contract between View and ViewModel

2. **Testability**
   ```swift

       let vm = FeedViewModel()
       await vm.loadFeed()

       XCTAssertFalse(vm.isLoading)  // Can read state
       XCTAssertFalse(vm.posts.isEmpty)
       // vm.isLoading = true  âŒ Can't mutate directly
   }
   ```

3. **Side Effects**
   - Easy to add analytics, logging, caching
   - All mutations go through methods
   - Example: Auto-save on every change (HWS pattern)

4. **API Clarity**
   ```swift
   // Clear API surface:
   viewModel.loadFeed()           âœ… Action
   viewModel.selectSquad("Carroll") âœ… Action
   viewModel.filteredPosts         âœ… Read data
   // viewModel.posts = []          âŒ Not possible
   ```

struct CircleFilter: View {

    let imageName: String?

    let action: () -> Void

        isSelected: Bool = false,
        action: @escaping () -> Void
    ) {

        self.icon = icon
        self.imageName = imageName
        self.iconColor = iconColor
        self.isSelected = isSelected
        self.action = action

            VStack(spacing: .spacing2) {
                // Circle with content
                ZStack {
                    // Outer ring
                    Circle()
                        .strokeBorder(
                            LinearGradient(
                                colors: isSelected
                                    ? [iconColor, iconColor.opacity(0.6)]
                                    : [Color.white.opacity(0.3), Color.white.opacity(0.3)],
                                startPoint: .topLeading,
                                endPoint: .bottomTrailing
                            ),
                            lineWidth: 3
                        )
                        .frame(width: 70, height: 70)

                    // Inner circle
                    Circle()
                        .fill(
                            LinearGradient(
                                colors: isSelected
                                    ? [iconColor.opacity(0.3), iconColor.opacity(0.2)]
                                    : [Color.white.opacity(0.2), Color.white.opacity(0.1)],
                                startPoint: .topLeading,
                                endPoint: .bottomTrailing
                            )
                        )
                        .frame(width: 64, height: 64)

                    // Content (image or icon)
                    if let imageName = imageName {
                        Image(imageName)
                            .resizable()
                            .scaledToFill()
                            .frame(width: 64, height: 64)
                            .clipShape(Circle())
                    } else if let icon = icon {
                        Image(systemName: icon)
                            .font(.system(size: 28))
                            .foregroundColor(isSelected ? iconColor : .gray)
                    }
                }

                // Name label
                Text(name)
                    .font(.caption)
                    .fontWeight(isSelected ? .semibold : .regular)
                    .foregroundColor(isSelected ? .white : .gray)
                    .lineLimit(1)
            }
            .frame(width: 80)
        }
        .accessibilityLabel("\(name) filter")
        .accessibilityAddTraits(isSelected ? .isSelected : [])
        .accessibilityHint(isSelected ? "Currently selected" : "Double tap to select")
    }
}

import SwiftUI

struct MenuItem<Destination: View>: View {
    let icon: String
    let title: String
    let iconColor: Color
    let destination: Destination?
    let action: (() -> Void)?

    init(
        icon: String,
        title: String,
        iconColor: Color = .brandPrimary,
        destination: Destination
    ) where Destination: View {
        self.icon = icon
        self.title = title
        self.iconColor = iconColor
        self.destination = destination
        self.action = nil
    }

    init(
        icon: String,
        title: String,
        iconColor: Color = .brandPrimary,
        action: @escaping () -> Void
    ) where Destination == EmptyView {
        self.icon = icon
        self.title = title
        self.iconColor = iconColor
        self.destination = nil
        self.action = action
    }

    var body: some View {
        Group {
            if let destination = destination {
                NavigationLink(destination: destination) {
                    content
                }
            } else {
                Button(action: action ?? {}) {
                    content
                }
            }
        }
        .accessibilityElement(combining: .children)
        .accessibilityLabel(title)
        .accessibilityHint("Navigate to \(title)")

            Image(systemName: "chevron.right")

import SwiftUI

enum UserType: String, Codable {
    case athlete = "Athlete"
    case clubCoach = "Club Coach"
    case collegeCoach = "College Coach"
    case parent = "Parent"

    var accentColor: Color {
        switch self {
        case .athlete:
            return .blue
        case .clubCoach:
            return .orange
        case .collegeCoach:
            return .red
        case .parent:
            return .green
        }
    }

    var gradientColors: [Color] {
        switch self {
        case .athlete:
            return [.blue, .purple]
        case .clubCoach:
            return [.orange, Color(red: 1.0, green: 0.4, blue: 0.0)]
        case .collegeCoach:
            return [.red, Color(red: 1.0, green: 0.2, blue: 0.4)]
        case .parent:
            return [.green, .teal]
        }
    }

    var gradient: LinearGradient {
        LinearGradient(
            colors: gradientColors,
            startPoint: .topLeading,
            endPoint: .bottomTrailing
        )
    }
}

// Environment key
struct UserTypeKey: EnvironmentKey {
    static let defaultValue: UserType = .athlete
}

extension EnvironmentValues {
    var userType: UserType {
        get { self[UserTypeKey.self] }
        set { self[UserTypeKey.self] = newValue }
    }
}
```

import SwiftUI

struct StatItem {
    let value: String
    let label: String
    let icon: String?
}

struct StatsBar: View {
    let stats: [StatItem]
    var style: StatsStyle = .horizontal

    enum StatsStyle {
        case horizontal
        case vertical
    }

    var body: some View {
        Group {
            switch style {
            case .horizontal:
                horizontalLayout
            case .vertical:
                verticalLayout
            }
        }
    }

    private var horizontalLayout: some View {
        HStack(spacing: 0) {
            ForEach(Array(stats.enumerated()), id: \.offset) { index, stat in
                StatItemView(stat: stat)
                    .frame(maxWidth: .infinity)

                if index < stats.count - 1 {
                    Divider()
                }
            }
        }
        .glassCard()
    }

    private var verticalLayout: some View {
        VStack(spacing: .spacing3) {
            ForEach(Array(stats.enumerated()), id: \.offset) { index, stat in
                StatItemView(stat: stat, isVertical: true)

                if index < stats.count - 1 {
                    Divider()
                }
            }
        }
        .glassCard()
    }
}

struct StatItemView: View {
    let stat: StatItem
    var isVertical: Bool = false

    var body: some View {
        VStack(spacing: .spacing2) {
            if let icon = stat.icon {
                Image(systemName: icon)
                    .font(.caption)
                    .foregroundColor(.brandPrimary)
                    .accessibilityHidden(true)
            }

            Text(stat.value)
                .font(.title3)
                .fontWeight(.bold)
                .foregroundColor(.primary)

            Text(stat.label)
                .font(.caption)
                .foregroundColor(.secondary)
        }
        .padding(.spacing3)
        .frame(maxWidth: isVertical ? .infinity : nil, alignment: isVertical ? .leading : .center)
        .accessibilityElement(combining: .children)
        .accessibilityLabel("\(stat.value) \(stat.label)")
    }
}

struct ButtonPressModifier: ViewModifier {
    @State private var isPressed = false
    @Environment(\.accessibilityReduceMotion) var reduceMotion

    func body(content: Content) -> some View {
        content
            .scaleEffect(isPressed && !reduceMotion ? 0.95 : 1.0)
            .opacity(isPressed ? 0.8 : 1.0)
            .gesture(
                DragGesture(minimumDistance: 0)
                    .onChanged { _ in
                        if !isPressed {
                            isPressed = true
                            UIImpactFeedbackGenerator(style: .medium).impactOccurred()
                        }
                    }
                    .onEnded { _ in
                        isPressed = false
                    }
            )
    }
}

extension View {
    func buttonPressEffect() -> some View {
        modifier(ButtonPressModifier())
    }
}
```

import SwiftUI

/// A glass-morphism card with blur effect and border
/// Uses DesignTheme colors for consistent styling
struct GlassCard<Content: View>: View {
    let content: Content
    var cornerRadius: CGFloat = .radiusLarge
    var padding: CGFloat = .spacing4

    @Environment(\.designTheme) private var theme
    @Environment(\.colorScheme) private var colorScheme

    init(
        cornerRadius: CGFloat = .radiusLarge,
        padding: CGFloat = .spacing4,
        @ViewBuilder content: () -> Content
    ) {
        self.cornerRadius = cornerRadius
        self.padding = padding
        self.content = content()
    }

    var body: some View {
        content
            .padding(padding)
            .background(
                RoundedRectangle(cornerRadius: cornerRadius, style: .continuous)
                    .fill(theme.color(.card))
                    .overlay(
                        RoundedRectangle(cornerRadius: cornerRadius, style: .continuous)
                            .stroke(theme.color(.border).opacity(0.3), lineWidth: 1)
                    )
            )
    }
}

// ViewModifier version
struct GlassCardModifier: ViewModifier {
    var cornerRadius: CGFloat = .radiusLarge

    @Environment(\.designTheme) private var theme

    func body(content: Content) -> some View {
        content
            .background(
                RoundedRectangle(cornerRadius: cornerRadius, style: .continuous)
                    .fill(theme.color(.card))
                    .overlay(
                        RoundedRectangle(cornerRadius: cornerRadius, style: .continuous)
                            .stroke(theme.color(.border).opacity(0.3), lineWidth: 1)
                    )
            )
    }
}

extension View {
    func glassCard(cornerRadius: CGFloat = .radiusLarge) -> some View {
        modifier(GlassCardModifier(cornerRadius: cornerRadius))
    }
}
```

### 2.2a Enhance MVVM with Access Control & Best Practices âœ… COMPLETED

**Goal:** Refine existing ViewModels to follow Hacking with Swift best practices for better encapsulation and API design.

**Based on:** [Hacking with Swift - Introducing MVVM](https://www.hackingwithswift.com/books/ios-swiftui/introducing-mvvm-into-your-swiftui-project)

**Current State:**
- âœ… ViewModels created and integrated (FeedViewModel, SearchViewModel)
- âŒ Properties are publicly mutable (not encapsulated)
- âŒ No clear API surface for state mutations
- âŒ Missing automatic persistence patterns

**Key Improvements from HWS:**

1. **Access Control with `private(set)`**
   - Make state properties read-only from outside
   - Force mutations through methods for better control
   - Clearer API surface for consumers

2. **Controlled Mutations**
   - All state changes go through methods
   - Easier to add side effects (analytics, logging, persistence)
   - Better testability

3. **Practical MVVM**
   - "There is no single definition of MVVM" - be flexible
   - Don't move everything - simple state can stay in views
   - Focus on testability as the main benefit

**Implementation:**

**Before (Current Pattern):**

import SwiftUI

struct MenuItem<Destination: View>: View {
    let icon: String
    let title: String
    let iconColor: Color
    let destination: Destination?
    let action: (() -> Void)?

    init(
        icon: String,
        title: String,
        iconColor: Color = .brandPrimary,
        destination: Destination
    ) where Destination: View {
        self.icon = icon
        self.title = title
        self.iconColor = iconColor
        self.destination = destination
        self.action = nil
    }

    init(
        icon: String,
        title: String,
        iconColor: Color = .brandPrimary,
        action: @escaping () -> Void
    ) where Destination == EmptyView {
        self.icon = icon
        self.title = title
        self.iconColor = iconColor
        self.destination = nil
        self.action = action
    }

    var body: some View {
        Group {
            if let destination = destination {
                NavigationLink(destination: destination) {
                    content
                }
            } else {
                Button(action: action ?? {}) {
                    content
                }
            }
        }
        .accessibilityElement(combining: .children)
        .accessibilityLabel(title)
        .accessibilityHint("Navigate to \(title)")
    }

import SwiftUI

enum UserType: String, Codable {
    case athlete = "Athlete"
    case clubCoach = "Club Coach"
    case collegeCoach = "College Coach"
    case parent = "Parent"

    var accentColor: Color {
        switch self {
        case .athlete:
            return .blue
        case .clubCoach:
            return .orange
        case .collegeCoach:
            return .red
        case .parent:
            return .green
        }
    }

    var gradientColors: [Color] {
        switch self {
        case .athlete:
            return [.blue, .purple]
        case .clubCoach:
            return [.orange, Color(red: 1.0, green: 0.4, blue: 0.0)]
        case .collegeCoach:
            return [.red, Color(red: 1.0, green: 0.2, blue: 0.4)]
        case .parent:
            return [.green, .teal]
        }
    }

    var gradient: LinearGradient {
        LinearGradient(
            colors: gradientColors,
            startPoint: .topLeading,
            endPoint: .bottomTrailing
        )
    }
}

// Environment key
struct UserTypeKey: EnvironmentKey {
    static let defaultValue: UserType = .athlete
}

extension EnvironmentValues {
    var userType: UserType {
        get { self[UserTypeKey.self] }
        set { self[UserTypeKey.self] = newValue }
    }
}

import SwiftUI

struct StatItem {
    let value: String
    let label: String
    let icon: String?
}

struct StatsBar: View {
    let stats: [StatItem]
    var style: StatsStyle = .horizontal

    enum StatsStyle {
        case horizontal
        case vertical
    }

    var body: some View {
        Group {
            switch style {
            case .horizontal:
                horizontalLayout
            case .vertical:
                verticalLayout
            }
        }
    }

    private var horizontalLayout: some View {
        HStack(spacing: 0) {
            ForEach(Array(stats.enumerated()), id: \.offset) { index, stat in
                StatItemView(stat: stat)
                    .frame(maxWidth: .infinity)

                if index < stats.count - 1 {
                    Divider()
                }
            }
        }
        .glassCard()
    }

    private var verticalLayout: some View {
        VStack(spacing: .spacing3) {
            ForEach(Array(stats.enumerated()), id: \.offset) { index, stat in
                StatItemView(stat: stat, isVertical: true)

                if index < stats.count - 1 {
                    Divider()
                }
            }
        }
        .glassCard()
    }
}

struct StatItemView: View {
    let stat: StatItem
    var isVertical: Bool = false

    var body: some View {
        VStack(spacing: .spacing2) {
            if let icon = stat.icon {
                Image(systemName: icon)
                    .font(.caption)
                    .foregroundColor(.brandPrimary)
                    .accessibilityHidden(true)
            }

            Text(stat.value)
                .font(.title3)
                .fontWeight(.bold)
                .foregroundColor(.primary)

            Text(stat.label)
                .font(.caption)
                .foregroundColor(.secondary)
        }
        .padding(.spacing3)
        .frame(maxWidth: isVertical ? .infinity : nil, alignment: isVertical ? .leading : .center)
        .accessibilityElement(combining: .children)
        .accessibilityLabel("\(stat.value) \(stat.label)")
    }
}

struct ButtonPressModifier: ViewModifier {
    @State private var isPressed = false
    @Environment(\.accessibilityReduceMotion) var reduceMotion

    func body(content: Content) -> some View {
        content
            .scaleEffect(isPressed && !reduceMotion ? 0.95 : 1.0)
            .opacity(isPressed ? 0.8 : 1.0)
            .gesture(
                DragGesture(minimumDistance: 0)
                    .onChanged { _ in
                        if !isPressed {
                            isPressed = true
                            UIImpactFeedbackGenerator(style: .medium).impactOccurred()
                        }
                    }
                    .onEnded { _ in
                        isPressed = false
                    }
            )
    }
}

    }
}

   - *Risk:* Tasks take longer than estimated
