```swift
import SwiftUI

/// A glass-morphism card with blur effect and border
/// Uses DesignTheme colors for consistent styling
struct GlassCard<Content: View>: View {
    let content: Content
    var cornerRadius: CGFloat = .radiusLarge
    var padding: CGFloat = .spacing4

    @Environment(\.designTheme) private var theme
    @Environment(\.colorScheme) private var colorScheme

    init(
        cornerRadius: CGFloat = .radiusLarge,
        padding: CGFloat = .spacing4,
        @ViewBuilder content: () -> Content
    ) {
        self.cornerRadius = cornerRadius
        self.padding = padding
        self.content = content()
    }

    var body: some View {
        content
            .padding(padding)
            .background(
                RoundedRectangle(cornerRadius: cornerRadius, style: .continuous)
                    .fill(theme.color(.card))
                    .overlay(
                        RoundedRectangle(cornerRadius: cornerRadius, style: .continuous)
                            .stroke(theme.color(.border).opacity(0.3), lineWidth: 1)
                    )
            )
    }
}

// ViewModifier version
struct GlassCardModifier: ViewModifier {
    var cornerRadius: CGFloat = .radiusLarge

    @Environment(\.designTheme) private var theme

    func body(content: Content) -> some View {
        content
            .background(
                RoundedRectangle(cornerRadius: cornerRadius, style: .continuous)
                    .fill(theme.color(.card))
                    .overlay(
                        RoundedRectangle(cornerRadius: cornerRadius, style: .continuous)
                            .stroke(theme.color(.border).opacity(0.3), lineWidth: 1)
                    )
            )
    }
}

extension View {
    func glassCard(cornerRadius: CGFloat = .radiusLarge) -> some View {
        modifier(GlassCardModifier(cornerRadius: cornerRadius))
```
```swift
    }
}
```

```swift
// MARK: - Enhanced DSButton with Icons & Loading
extension DSButton {
    /// Enhanced button with icon and loading state support
    init(
        _ title: String,
        icon: String? = nil,
        intent: Intent = .primary,
        size: Size = .m,
        isLoading: Bool = false,
        action: @escaping () -> Void

        self.intent = intent
        self.size = size
        self.isLoading = isLoading
        self.icon = icon
        self.action = {
            // Add haptic feedback
            UIImpactFeedbackGenerator(style: .medium).impactOccurred()
            action()
        }
    }
}

// MARK: - App-Specific Button Wrapper
struct BrandButton: View {
    let title: String
    let icon: String?
    let style: ButtonStyle
    let isLoading: Bool
    let action: () -> Void

    enum ButtonStyle {
        case primary
        case secondary
        case destructive
        case outline

        var dsIntent: DSButton.Intent {
            switch self {
            case .primary: return .primary
            case .secondary: return .secondary
            case .destructive: return .destructive
            case .outline: return .secondary // Will customize
            }
        }
    }

    @Environment(\.isEnabled) private var isEnabled
    @Environment(\.designTheme) private var theme

    init(
        title: String,
        icon: String? = nil,
        style: ButtonStyle = .primary,
        isLoading: Bool = false,
        action: @escaping () -> Void
    ) {
        self.title = title
        self.icon = icon
        self.style = style
        self.isLoading = isLoading
        self.action = action
    }

    var body: some View {
        if style == .outline {
            // Custom outline style
            outlineButton
        } else {
            // Use DSButton for standard styles
            DSButton(
                title,
                icon: icon,
                intent: style.dsIntent,
                isLoading: isLoading,
                action: action
            )
        }
    }

    private var outlineButton: some View {
        Button(action: {
            UIImpactFeedbackGenerator(style: .medium).impactOccurred()
            action()
        }) {
            HStack(spacing: .spacing3) {
                if isLoading {
                    ProgressView()
                        .tint(theme.color(.primary))
                } else {
                    if let icon = icon {
                        Image(systemName: icon)
                    }
                    Text(title)
                        .font(theme.font(.body))
                }
            }
            .frame(maxWidth: .infinity)
            .padding()
            .foregroundStyle(theme.color(.primary))
            .background(
                RoundedRectangle(cornerRadius: .radiusLarge, style: .continuous)
                    .stroke(theme.color(.primary), lineWidth: 2)
            )
        }
        .disabled(!isEnabled || isLoading)
        .opacity(isEnabled ? 1.0 : 0.5)
        .accessibilityLabel(title)
```
```swift
    }
}
```

### 2.2a Enhance MVVM with Access Control & Best Practices âœ… COMPLETED

**Goal:** Refine existing ViewModels to follow Hacking with Swift best practices for better encapsulation and API design.

**Based on:** [Hacking with Swift - Introducing MVVM](https://www.hackingwithswift.com/books/ios-swiftui/introducing-mvvm-into-your-swiftui-project)

**Current State:**
- âœ… ViewModels created and integrated (FeedViewModel, SearchViewModel)
- âŒ Properties are publicly mutable (not encapsulated)
- âŒ No clear API surface for state mutations
- âŒ Missing automatic persistence patterns

**Key Improvements from HWS:**

1. **Access Control with `private(set)`**
   - Make state properties read-only from outside
   - Force mutations through methods for better control
   - Clearer API surface for consumers

2. **Controlled Mutations**
   - All state changes go through methods
   - Easier to add side effects (analytics, logging, persistence)
   - Better testability

3. **Practical MVVM**
   - "There is no single definition of MVVM" - be flexible
   - Don't move everything - simple state can stay in views
   - Focus on testability as the main benefit

**Implementation:**

**Before (Current Pattern):**
```swift
@Observable
class FeedViewModel {
    var posts: [FeedPost] = []  // Publicly mutable âŒ
    var isLoading = false
    var selectedFilter: FeedFilter = .all

    func loadFeed() async {
        isLoading = true  // Direct mutation
        // ...
    }
}

// Usage in View:
viewModel.posts.append(newPost)  // Can mutate directly âŒ
```

**After (HWS Pattern with private(set)):**
```swift
@Observable
class FeedViewModel {
    // MARK: - Published State (read-only from outside)
    private(set) var posts: [FeedPost] = []  âœ…
    private(set) var isLoading = false
    private(set) var error: Error?

    // MARK: - User-controlled State (can be modified by view)
    var selectedFilter: FeedFilter = .all
    var showCreatePost = false

    // MARK: - Computed Properties
    var filteredPosts: [FeedPost] {
        switch selectedFilter {
        case .all: return posts
        case .squad(let name): return posts.filter { $0.squad == name }
        // ... other filters
        }
    }

    // MARK: - Actions (controlled mutations)
    func loadFeed() async {
        isLoading = true  âœ… Only ViewModel can set this
        error = nil

        do {
            let fetchedPosts = try await fetchPosts()
            posts = fetchedPosts  âœ… Controlled mutation
            isLoading = false
        } catch {
            self.error = error
            isLoading = false
        }
    }

    func selectSquad(_ squad: String?) {
        selectedFilter = squad.map { .squad($0) } ?? .all
        Task { await loadFeed() }
    }

    func toggleCreatePost() {
        showCreatePost.toggle()
    }

    func addPost(_ post: FeedPost) {
        posts.insert(post, at: 0)  âœ… Controlled mutation
        saveToCache()  // Easy to add side effects
    }

    // MARK: - Private Helpers
    private func fetchPosts() async throws -> [FeedPost] {
        // API call
        []
    }

    private func saveToCache() {
        // Automatic persistence (HWS pattern)
    }
}

// Usage in View:
// viewModel.posts.append(newPost)  âŒ Compile error!
viewModel.addPost(newPost)  âœ… Must use method
```

**Benefits:**

1. **Encapsulation**
   - State can only be modified through well-defined methods
   - Prevents accidental mutations from views
   - Clear contract between View and ViewModel

2. **Testability**

   ```swift
       let vm = FeedViewModel()
       await vm.loadFeed()

       XCTAssertFalse(vm.isLoading)  // Can read state
       XCTAssertFalse(vm.posts.isEmpty)
   ```

3. **Side Effects**
   - Easy to add analytics, logging, caching
   - All mutations go through methods
   - Example: Auto-save on every change (HWS pattern)

   ```swift
   viewModel.loadFeed()           âœ… Action
   viewModel.selectSquad("Carroll") âœ… Action
   viewModel.filteredPosts         âœ… Read data
   // viewModel.posts = []          âŒ Not possible
   ```

```swift
struct CircleFilter: View {

    let imageName: String?

    let action: () -> Void

        isSelected: Bool = false,
        action: @escaping () -> Void
    ) {

        self.icon = icon
        self.imageName = imageName
        self.iconColor = iconColor
        self.isSelected = isSelected
        self.action = action
    }

            VStack(spacing: .spacing2) {
                // Circle with content
                ZStack {
                    // Outer ring
                    Circle()
                        .strokeBorder(
                            LinearGradient(
                                colors: isSelected
                                    ? [iconColor, iconColor.opacity(0.6)]
                                    : [Color.white.opacity(0.3), Color.white.opacity(0.3)],
                                startPoint: .topLeading,
                                endPoint: .bottomTrailing
                            ),
                            lineWidth: 3
                        )
                        .frame(width: 70, height: 70)

                    // Inner circle
                    Circle()
                        .fill(
                            LinearGradient(
                                colors: isSelected
                                    ? [iconColor.opacity(0.3), iconColor.opacity(0.2)]

                    .foregroundColor(isSelected ? .white : .gray)
```

```swift
import SwiftUI

struct MenuItem<Destination: View>: View {
    let icon: String
    let title: String
    let iconColor: Color
    let destination: Destination?
    let action: (() -> Void)?

    init(
        icon: String,
        title: String,
        iconColor: Color = .brandPrimary,
        destination: Destination
    ) where Destination: View {
        self.icon = icon
        self.title = title
        self.iconColor = iconColor
        self.destination = destination
        self.action = nil
    }

    init(
        icon: String,
        title: String,
        iconColor: Color = .brandPrimary,
        action: @escaping () -> Void
    ) where Destination == EmptyView {
        self.icon = icon
        self.title = title
        self.iconColor = iconColor
        self.destination = nil
        self.action = action
    }

    var body: some View {
        Group {
            if let destination = destination {
                NavigationLink(destination: destination) {
                    content
                }
            } else {
                Button(action: action ?? {}) {
                    content
                }
            }
        }
        .accessibilityElement(combining: .children)
        .accessibilityLabel(title)
        .accessibilityHint("Navigate to \(title)")
    }

    private var content: some View {
        HStack(spacing: .spacing4) {
            Image(systemName: icon)
```

```swift
import SwiftUI

enum UserType: String, Codable {
    case athlete = "Athlete"
    case clubCoach = "Club Coach"
    case collegeCoach = "College Coach"
    case parent = "Parent"

    var accentColor: Color {
        switch self {
        case .athlete:
            return .blue
        case .clubCoach:
            return .orange
        case .collegeCoach:
            return .red
        case .parent:
            return .green
        }
    }

    var gradientColors: [Color] {
        switch self {
        case .athlete:
            return [.blue, .purple]
        case .clubCoach:
            return [.orange, Color(red: 1.0, green: 0.4, blue: 0.0)]
        case .collegeCoach:
            return [.red, Color(red: 1.0, green: 0.2, blue: 0.4)]
        case .parent:
            return [.green, .teal]
        }
    }

    var gradient: LinearGradient {
        LinearGradient(
            colors: gradientColors,
            startPoint: .topLeading,
            endPoint: .bottomTrailing
        )
    }
}

// Environment key
struct UserTypeKey: EnvironmentKey {
    static let defaultValue: UserType = .athlete
}

extension EnvironmentValues {
    var userType: UserType {
        get { self[UserTypeKey.self] }
        set { self[UserTypeKey.self] = newValue }
```
```swift
    }
}
```

```swift
import SwiftUI

struct StatItem {

    var style: StatsStyle = .horizontal

            ForEach(Array(stats.enumerated()), id: \.offset) { index, stat in

        VStack(spacing: .spacing3) {
            ForEach(Array(stats.enumerated()), id: \.offset) { index, stat in
                StatItemView(stat: stat, isVertical: true)

                if index < stats.count - 1 {
                    Divider()
                }
            }
        }
        .glassCard()
    }
```

```swift
struct ButtonPressModifier: ViewModifier {
    @State private var isPressed = false
    @Environment(\.accessibilityReduceMotion) var reduceMotion

    func body(content: Content) -> some View {
        content
            .scaleEffect(isPressed && !reduceMotion ? 0.95 : 1.0)
            .opacity(isPressed ? 0.8 : 1.0)
            .gesture(
                DragGesture(minimumDistance: 0)
                    .onChanged { _ in
                        if !isPressed {
                            isPressed = true
                            UIImpactFeedbackGenerator(style: .medium).impactOccurred()
                        }
                    }
                    .onEnded { _ in
                        isPressed = false
                    }
            )
    }
}

extension View {
    func buttonPressEffect() -> some View {
        modifier(ButtonPressModifier())
    }
```
```swift
}
```

## Risk Management

### Identified Risks

1. **Scope Creep**
   - *Risk:* Adding features instead of focusing on design system
   - *Mitigation:* Strict adherence to plan, no new features
   - *Impact:* High
   - *Likelihood:* Medium

2. **Breaking Changes**
   - *Risk:* Refactoring breaks existing functionality
   - *Mitigation:* Incremental changes, thorough testing
   - *Impact:* High
   - *Likelihood:* Medium

3. **Time Constraints**
   - *Risk:* Tasks take longer than estimated
   - *Mitigation:* Buffer week built in, prioritize critical items
   - *Impact:* Medium
   - *Likelihood:* High

4. **Accessibility Complexity**
   - *Risk:* Accessibility testing reveals more work than expected
   - *Mitigation:* Start early, dedicate full week
   - *Impact:* Medium
   - *Likelihood:* Medium

5. **Device Coverage**
   - *Risk:* Not enough devices for thorough testing
   - *Mitigation:* Use simulator + TestFlight beta
   - *Impact:* Low
   - *Likelihood:* Low

### Contingency Plans

**If behind schedule after Week 2:**
- Focus on critical components only (GlassCard, BrandButton, FeedPost)
- Defer nice-to-have components to Phase 6
- Maintain accessibility as non-negotiable

**If breaking changes occur:**
- Revert to last working state
- Implement changes in smaller increments
- Add unit tests before proceeding

## MVVM Patterns

### ViewModel Structure

```swift
import SwiftUI
import Observation

@Observable
class FeatureViewModel {
    // MARK: - Published State (private(set) for encapsulation)
    private(set) var data: [Item] = []
    private(set) var isLoading = false
    private(set) var error: Error?

    // MARK: - User-controlled State (public for two-way binding)
    var searchText = ""
    var selectedFilter: Filter?
    var showSheet = false

    // MARK: - Computed Properties (derived state)
    var filteredData: [Item] {
        guard !searchText.isEmpty else { return data }
        return data.filter { $0.name.contains(searchText) }
    }

    var hasActiveFilters: Bool {
        selectedFilter != nil
    }

    // MARK: - Lifecycle
    init() {
        // Load cached data if needed
        loadFromCache()
    }

    // MARK: - Actions (public methods for controlled mutations)
    func loadData() async {
        isLoading = true
        error = nil

        do {
            let fetchedData = try await fetchFromAPI()
            data = fetchedData
            isLoading = false
            saveToCache()  // Auto-save pattern
        } catch {
            self.error = error
            isLoading = false
        }
    }

    func addItem(_ item: Item) {
        data.insert(item, at: 0)
        saveToCache()
    }

    func deleteItem(_ item: Item) {
        data.removeAll { $0.id == item.id }
        saveToCache()
    }

    func applyFilter(_ filter: Filter?) {
        selectedFilter = filter
        Task { await loadData() }
    }

    // MARK: - Private Helpers
    private func fetchFromAPI() async throws -> [Item] {
        // API implementation
        []
    }

    private func loadFromCache() {
        // Load persisted data
    }

    private func saveToCache() {
        // Persist data automatically
    }
}
```

### ViewModel Conventions

1. **Access Control**
   - Use `private(set)` for state that only ViewModel can mutate
   - Use public `var` for two-way bindings (searchText, toggles)
   - Use `private` for helper methods

2. **State Organization**
   - Group: Published State â†’ User-controlled â†’ Computed â†’ Actions â†’ Private
   - Clear separation of concerns

3. **Error Handling**
   - Typed errors when possible
   - Set error state, don't throw to view
   - Provide user-friendly error messages

4. **Async Operations**
   - All async methods use `async/await`
   - Set loading states
   - Handle errors gracefully

5. **Side Effects**
   - Auto-save after mutations (HWS pattern)
   - Analytics, logging in action methods
   - Clear, testable side effects

### View Integration

```swift
struct FeatureView: View {
    @State private var viewModel = FeatureViewModel()

    var body: some View {
        Group {
            if viewModel.isLoading {
                LoadingView(message: "Loading...")
            } else if let error = viewModel.error {
                ErrorView(
                    title: "Error",
                    message: error.localizedDescription,
                    retryAction: { Task { await viewModel.loadData() } }
                )
            } else {
                content
            }
        }
        .task {
            await viewModel.loadData()
        }
    }

    private var content: some View {
        List {
            ForEach(viewModel.filteredData) { item in
                ItemRow(item: item)
            }
        }
        .searchable(text: $viewModel.searchText)
    }
}
```

### When to Use MVVM

âœ… **Use ViewModel when:**
- Business logic exists (API calls, calculations, validations)
- State is complex (multiple related properties)
- Logic needs testing
- Multiple views share the same logic

âŒ **Skip ViewModel when:**
- Pure presentation (static content)
- Simple state (single @State toggle)
- No business logic

**Example:** A settings toggle doesn't need a ViewModel. A login form with validation, API calls, and error handling does.

```swift
.accessibilityHint("Opens settings menu")

// Images need descriptions
Image("profile")
    .accessibilityLabel("\(userName)'s profile picture")

// Decorative elements should be hidden
Image(systemName: "chevron.right")
    .accessibilityHidden(true)

// Complex views should combine children
VStack {
    Text("John Doe")
    Text("Software Engineer")
}
.accessibilityElement(combining: .children)
```

### Dynamic Type

```swift
// âœ… Use semantic text styles (auto-scales)
Text("Title")
    .font(.headline)

// âœ… Limit scaling when necessary
Text("Large Title")
    .font(.largeTitle)
    .dynamicTypeSize(...DynamicTypeSize.xxxLarge)

// âŒ Never use fixed font sizes
Text("Title")
    .font(.system(size: 24))  // Won't scale!
```

### Color Contrast

```swift
// âœ… Use semantic colors (adapt for contrast)
Text("Label")
    .foregroundStyle(.primary)      // 100% contrast
    .foregroundStyle(.secondary)    // ~70% opacity, guaranteed readable

// âœ… Test custom colors for WCAG AA compliance
// Minimum contrast ratios:
// - Normal text: 4.5:1
// - Large text (18pt+): 3:1
// - UI components: 3:1
```

### Reduce Motion

```swift
@Environment(\.accessibilityReduceMotion) var reduceMotion

// Respect reduce motion preference
withAnimation(reduceMotion ? nil : .spring()) {
    selectedTab = tab
}

// Provide non-animated alternatives
.transition(reduceMotion ? .identity : .slide)
```

### Testing Accessibility

1. **VoiceOver** - Test with VoiceOver enabled (Cmd+F5)
2. **Dynamic Type** - Test at multiple text sizes (Settings > Accessibility)
3. **Color Contrast** - Use Color Contrast Analyzer tool
4. **Reduce Motion** - Enable in Settings > Accessibility

---

## Testing Strategy

### Unit Tests

```swift
import XCTest
@testable import athleadai

final class FeedViewModelTests: XCTestCase {
    var viewModel: FeedViewModel!

    override func setUp() {
        super.setUp()
        viewModel = FeedViewModel()
    }

    func testLoadFeed() async {
        // Given
        XCTAssertTrue(viewModel.posts.isEmpty)

        // When
        await viewModel.loadFeed()

        // Then
        XCTAssertFalse(viewModel.isLoading)
        XCTAssertFalse(viewModel.posts.isEmpty)
    }

    func testFilterPosts() async {
        // Given
        await viewModel.loadFeed()
        let initialCount = viewModel.posts.count

        // When
        viewModel.applyFilter(.squad("Test Squad"))

        // Then
        XCTAssertLessThanOrEqual(viewModel.filteredPosts.count, initialCount)
    }
}
```

### UI Tests

```swift
import XCTest

final class AuthFlowUITests: XCTestCase {
    var app: XCUIApplication!

    override func setUp() {
        super.setUp()
        continueAfterFailure = false
        app = XCUIApplication()
        app.launch()
    }

    func testSignInFlow() {
        // Navigate to sign in
        app.buttons["Get Started"].tap()

        // Verify sign in screen
        XCTAssertTrue(app.staticTexts["AthleadAI"].exists)
        XCTAssertTrue(app.buttons["Sign in with Email"].exists)
    }
}
```

### Preview Testing

```swift
// Use previews for rapid iteration
#Preview("Default State") {
    FeedView()
}

#Preview("Loading State") {
    FeedView()
        .environment(\.viewModel, FeedViewModel(isLoading: true))
}

#Preview("Error State") {
    FeedView()
        .environment(\.viewModel, FeedViewModel(error: .networkError))
}

#Preview("Dark Mode") {
    FeedView()
        .preferredColorScheme(.dark)
}

#Preview("Large Text") {
    FeedView()
        .environment(\.dynamicTypeSize, .xxxLarge)
}
```

## Common Patterns

### Navigation

```swift
// Use NavigationStack (iOS 16+)
NavigationStack {
    ListView()
}

// Programmatic navigation
@State private var path = NavigationPath()

NavigationStack(path: $path) {
    ListView()
        .navigationDestination(for: Item.self) { item in
            DetailView(item: item)
        }
}

// Navigate
path.append(selectedItem)
```

### Sheets & Modals

```swift
@State private var showSheet = false

Button("Show Sheet") {
    showSheet = true
}
.sheet(isPresented: $showSheet) {
    SheetView()
}

// Full screen cover
.fullScreenCover(isPresented: $showFullScreen) {
    FullScreenView()
}
```

### Loading States

```swift
Group {
    if viewModel.isLoading {
        ProgressView("Loading...")
    } else if let error = viewModel.error {
        ErrorView(error: error) {
            Task { await viewModel.retry() }
        }
    } else {
        content
    }
}
```

### List Performance

```swift
// Use ForEach with Identifiable
ForEach(viewModel.items) { item in
    ItemRow(item: item)
}

// Or with id parameter
ForEach(viewModel.items, id: \.id) { item in
    ItemRow(item: item)
}

// Swipe actions
.swipeActions {
    Button(role: .destructive) {
        viewModel.delete(item)
    } label: {
        Label("Delete", systemImage: "trash")
    }
}
```

### Form Validation

```swift
@Observable
class FormViewModel {
    var email = ""
    var password = ""

    var isEmailValid: Bool {
        email.contains("@") && email.contains(".")
    }

    var isPasswordValid: Bool {
        password.count >= 8
    }

    var canSubmit: Bool {
        isEmailValid && isPasswordValid && !isLoading
    }
}

// In view
BrandButton(
    title: "Submit",
    style: .primary,
    isLoading: viewModel.isLoading
) {
    Task { await viewModel.submit() }
}
.disabled(!viewModel.canSubmit)
```

## Onboarding Guide

### For New Developers

#### Day 1: Setup
1. Clone repository
2. Open `apps/ios/athleadai.xcodeproj`
3. Build and run (Cmd+R)
4. Review this documentation
5. Read `docs/ios-ui-design-improvement-plan.md`

#### Week 1: Familiarization
1. Explore codebase structure
2. Review design system in `Views/Shared/DesignSystem/`
3. Study existing ViewModels in `ViewModels/`
4. Build a small feature using MVVM pattern
5. Write tests for your feature

#### Week 2: Contributing
1. Pick a task from improvement plan
2. Follow MVVM patterns
3. Use design system components
4. Write tests
5. Submit PR for review

### Quick Reference

**Creating a New Feature**

1. **Create ViewModel**
   ```swift
   // ViewModels/Feature/FeatureViewModel.swift
   @Observable
   class FeatureViewModel {
       private(set) var data: [Item] = []
       private(set) var isLoading = false

       func loadData() async { }
   }
   ```

2. **Create View**
   ```swift
   // Views/Athlete/Feature/FeatureView.swift
   struct FeatureView: View {
       @State private var viewModel = FeatureViewModel()

       var body: some View {
           // Use design system components
       }
   }
   ```

3. **Use Design System**
   - Colors: `theme.color(.primary)`
   - Typography: `theme.font(.headline)`
   - Spacing: `.spacing4`
   - Components: `GlassCard`, `BrandButton`, etc.

   - Dynamic Type support
   - Color contrast
   - Reduce motion

5. **Write Tests**
   - Unit tests for ViewModel
   - UI tests for critical flows
   - Previews for visual testing

âŒ **Don't:**
- Put business logic in views
- Use fixed font sizes
- Hardcode colors
- Forget accessibility labels
- Skip tests
- Directly mutate ViewModel state from views

âœ… **Do:**
- Use ViewModels for logic
- Use semantic text styles
- Use design system colors
- Add accessibility support
- Write tests
- Use ViewModel methods for mutations
